commit_message:
Fix wrapping regexp validation errors in dynamic ui

Previously our custom `message` string was assigned to `messages`
attribute which was wrong because it is getter-only property.

Change-Id: Ibc83cd8d714244d62337f32c70e40191bfad0b66

commit_message:
Metadata reflection only for sqlite in-memory

All the metadata models uncontested reflect to a test database even if
migrations has been already synced. Database should be filled with
tables or from `metadata` object or from migrations. This both ways
should be guaranteed mutually exclusive.

Closes-Bug: #1319370
Change-Id: I49148d01e4746bdda8b841944416fb0ce60fdc28

subject: Move memorycache expiry out of .get method
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}, {'_account_id': 7579, 'name': 'jan grant', 'email': 'jan.grant@hpe.com', 'username': 'jang'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 9420, 'name': 'Matthew Gilliard', 'email': 'matthew.gilliard@hp.com', 'username': 'gilliard'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-04-08 08:50:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/memorycache.py', 'tests/unit/test_memorycache.py'], 'message': 'Move memorycache expiry out of .get method

The entire memory cache was being scanned for items which had passed
their timeout every time an item was fetched.  This could cause a
performance problem for large caches.

This patch still has the clean on the .get method, but will skip the
cache cleaning unless >60s has elapsed since the last time.  A
method is exposed for clients to call if they have a busy cache that
needs cleaning more often.

Closes-Bug: #1276530

Change-Id: Ibe92b20bb389a392d6a62093ca6305a9d492a64f
'}]
commit_message:
Move memorycache expiry out of .get method

The entire memory cache was being scanned for items which had passed
their timeout every time an item was fetched.  This could cause a
performance problem for large caches.

This patch still has the clean on the .get method, but will skip the
cache cleaning unless >60s has elapsed since the last time.  A
method is exposed for clients to call if they have a busy cache that
needs cleaning more often.

Closes-Bug: #1276530

Change-Id: Ibe92b20bb389a392d6a62093ca6305a9d492a64f

commit_message:
Add test create volume and boot instance

Add new test in smoke test run:
* create volume from image
* wait available status
* boot instance from created volume
* wait active status
* delete instance
* delete volume
* check that volume deletion complete

Change-Id: I4dac775128db0fb1ef92811a36c2e88dda1f0889
Closes-Bug: #1319276

commit_message:
Allow package_get by name

If package lookup by id fails, filter by fully_qualified_name
and choose the first (and what will be only) result. Also allows
delete and update to use FQN as well as ID.

This may need revisiting to allow non-unique FQNs.

Change-Id: I84fb8e155b5aa4bc036f8b598101b6b969962325
Implements: blueprint id-fqn-equivalence

commit_message:
PKI key/cert generation for use with Keystone

Allow generating CA key + certificate and a signing key +
certificate. This will be generated on seed/undercloud and Heat +
os-apply-config will be used to get the files into place on
undercloud/overcloud.

Partially implements: blueprint tripleo-keystone-cloud-config

Change-Id: Ide692f372faa0907447fcb9971a8bdeec86130dd

commit_message:
Allow extensions to add Angular modules

This change allows extension plugins to make use of AngularJS without
changing horizon template or javascript files.
Horizon bootstraps AngularJS once when a page loads with a list
of modules. An extension can register a list of modules and a list
of javascript files that contain these modules.

Implements blueprint: plugins-angular
Change-Id: I4a76363dd4a631cc0d2fc2c902c2f5cac0f073f2

subject: Use the mangle checksum fill rule regardless to the multi_host
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-09 07:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_linux_net.py'], 'message': 'Use the mangle checksum fill rule regardless to the multi_host

The checksum-fill is required even when you are running devstack,
in a nested kvm guest.
Always using the checksum-fill on all dhcp responses is safe, and does
not have significant impact.

The situation is similar when the checksum-fill first introduced to
nova.

See Also:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=910619#c6

Change-Id: I8a34d5f815f6bfef6d683965ed51a77e82af8834
'}]
commit_message:
Use the mangle checksum fill rule regardless to the multi_host

The checksum-fill is required even when you are running devstack,
in a nested kvm guest.
Always using the checksum-fill on all dhcp responses is safe, and does
not have significant impact.

The situation is similar when the checksum-fill first introduced to
nova.

See Also:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=910619#c6

Change-Id: I8a34d5f815f6bfef6d683965ed51a77e82af8834

commit_message:
Unset CentOS image parameters that affect on another images

The parameters DIB_CLOUD_IMAGE, BASE_IMAGE_FILE and DIB_IMAGE_SIZE
should be unset after centos image creating, because these parameters can be
used for building another images (for example, when we build all images)

Change-Id: I0e63f544ac2f3cb9fcf00cafb1d897514bde9554
Closes-bug: #1324585

commit_message:
log request start when tracing classes

When tracing rest calls for debugging purposes, logging the start
of the request is also extremely helpful, as it makes it possible
to discover that the key issue is glance is in a hung state and
not responding to any requests.

Prereq for blueprint:javelin2

Change-Id: I9aca99119fc1569c78788b11a8a32d72eaecd0a1

commit_message:
allow 'main' as valid name for find_test_caller

find_test_caller assumed that the rest clients were only ever run
under testr. With the introduction of javelin into the tempest
tree this will not be true. 'main' is a completely valid name
for well formed programs, so make that an option as well.

Prereq for blueprint:javelin2

Change-Id: I9a591eaa1cf4dabba58f06a64814611a05a51365

subject: Add extra pinning for Percona Package install to work from a Mirror
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-05-27 14:54:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/mysql-dev/install.d/03-mysql-dev', 'elements/mysql/pre-install.d/02-mysql', 'elements/mysql-dev/pre-install.d/02-mysql-dev'], 'message': 'Add extra pinning for Percona Package install to work from a Mirror

When a Mirror includes both MySQL and Percona packages we need to
pin to the Percona Packages.
Use the following environment variable:
   DIB_PERCONA_VERSION_IN_MIRROR
to pin to the specific version of these Percona libraries:
   libmysqlclient18-dev libmysqlclient18

DIB_PERCONA_VERSION_IN_MIRROR is only relevant when
DIB_PERCONA_INSTALL is set to PACKAGE_MIRROR

Change-Id: I8e114e5c8d124c07841510d35dd6edabba8bddec
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra pinning for Percona Package install to work from a Mirror

When a Mirror includes both MySQL and Percona packages we need to
pin to the Percona Packages.
Use the following environment variable:
   DIB_PERCONA_VERSION_IN_MIRROR
to pin to the specific version of these Percona libraries:
   libmysqlclient18-dev libmysqlclient18

DIB_PERCONA_VERSION_IN_MIRROR is only relevant when
DIB_PERCONA_INSTALL is set to PACKAGE_MIRROR

Change-Id: I8e114e5c8d124c07841510d35dd6edabba8bddec

code.

For now the scheduler run_instance rpc method is being removed as it is
unused.

In the K cycle the scheduler schedule_run_instance methods can be
removed which means that the run_instance compute rpc method can be
removed.

In the L cycle the run_instance compute method can be removed.

This also removes cells schedule_run_instance methods which have been
unused since Havana.

Change-Id: I284ac124fe2ec952db0feab61206eda2a20e40c8
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate run_instance and remove unnecessary code

This begins a deprecation path for the compute manager run_instance
code.

For now the scheduler run_instance rpc method is being removed as it is
unused.

In the K cycle the scheduler schedule_run_instance methods can be
removed which means that the run_instance compute rpc method can be
removed.

In the L cycle the run_instance compute method can be removed.

This also removes cells schedule_run_instance methods which have been
unused since Havana.

bp remove-cast-to-schedule-run-instance

Change-Id: I284ac124fe2ec952db0feab61206eda2a20e40c8

commit_message:
replaced e.message

BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6.

http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Replaced e.message with six.text_type(e) (uses unicode with
Python 2.x and str with Python 3.x) and added six as
requirement.

Change-Id: I8a7a33275daf3c3d2e691ae30f549dd411207761

commit_message:
Treat instance objects as objects in unrescue API flow

The compute API and manager are getting instance objects now but
treating them like primitive dicts still in several places, so this
cleans that up.

Cleans up the related tests so they are using objects as well to verify
the changes to compute api/manager are correct.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I81fa858a821a2137fce5970905b9b1c71c95304b

commit_message:
Treat instance objects as objects in rescue API flow

The compute API and manager are getting instance objects now but
treating them like primitive dicts still in several places, so this
cleans that up.

Also adds the instance to the warning log message in _get_rescue_image
since (a) I'm already in there and (b) it adds context for the message,
which is useful.

Cleans up the related tests so they are using objects as well to verify
the changes to compute api/manager are correct.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: Ibe4473fc08fd68676aaa1e1c9ba69161fc5f527e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-22 16:58:51.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/admin/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Cleanup docstring in test_l3_agent_scheduler

The docstring was incomplete in saying it required the
l3_agent_scheduler extension to be enabled.  I think it probably meant
to say that l3_agent_scheduler was listed in
network_feature_enabled.api_extensions, but that defaults to 'all' so
rather than explain how that config option works in the docstring, just
say that the l3_agent_scheduler extension is required and assume the
user understands how to configure Tempest.

Change-Id: If504bd6374b83dea24fa92f9ef6c852d76308ad1
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup docstring in test_l3_agent_scheduler

The docstring was incomplete in saying it required the
l3_agent_scheduler extension to be enabled.  I think it probably meant
to say that l3_agent_scheduler was listed in
network_feature_enabled.api_extensions, but that defaults to 'all' so
rather than explain how that config option works in the docstring, just
say that the l3_agent_scheduler extension is required and assume the
user understands how to configure Tempest.

Change-Id: If504bd6374b83dea24fa92f9ef6c852d76308ad1

subject: Workaround Heat not handling token expiry
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-05-28 19:13:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/keystone/os-apply-config/etc/keystone/keystone.conf'], 'message': 'Workaround Heat not handling token expiry

Heat cannot handle a token expiring mid-deploy. Until the heat bug is
fixed we can workaround it by upping the token expiry time. The value
of 4 hours is higher than the time we need to deploy a 30 node cloud
of real hardware, and less than the 5 hour upper maximum suggested by
Morgan Fainberg, Keystone core.

Change-Id: Ib079f8880b3672ac442804557baca954e8af87ff
Partial-Bug: #1306294
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround Heat not handling token expiry

Heat cannot handle a token expiring mid-deploy. Until the heat bug is
fixed we can workaround it by upping the token expiry time. The value
of 4 hours is higher than the time we need to deploy a 30 node cloud
of real hardware, and less than the 5 hour upper maximum suggested by
Morgan Fainberg, Keystone core.

Change-Id: Ib079f8880b3672ac442804557baca954e8af87ff

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-23 05:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'Catch InstanceNotFound exception if migration fails

When a VM with an attached iSCSI disk fails to migrate, the rollback methods
does not detach the disk from target host. What happens is _lookup_by_name()
fails, since the VM does not exist on the target host. In detach_volume(), it
is supposed to print a warning based on the correct error code being returned,
instead of throwing the exception. However, this is not happening, because
_lookup_by_name() throws an InstanceNotFound exception, rather than a
libvirt.libvirtError exception. So we also need to catch InstanceNotFound
exception, so that detach_volume() can continue to execute as expected.

Change-Id: I396c23d8137bf1e2834769c5483d2494506949ad
Closes-Bug: #1321082
(cherry picked from commit 52b57e82c7ef972508777a8bd3c7b937a3673d2d)
'}]
commit_message:
Catch InstanceNotFound exception if migration fails

When a VM with an attached iSCSI disk fails to migrate, the rollback methods
does not detach the disk from target host. What happens is _lookup_by_name()
fails, since the VM does not exist on the target host. In detach_volume(), it
is supposed to print a warning based on the correct error code being returned,
instead of throwing the exception. However, this is not happening, because
_lookup_by_name() throws an InstanceNotFound exception, rather than a
libvirt.libvirtError exception. So we also need to catch InstanceNotFound
exception, so that detach_volume() can continue to execute as expected.

Change-Id: I396c23d8137bf1e2834769c5483d2494506949ad
Closes-Bug: #1321082
(cherry picked from commit 52b57e82c7ef972508777a8bd3c7b937a3673d2d)

subject: Finish factoring apart the graph_action module
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-05-29 20:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'doc/source/engines.rst', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/runtime.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/runner.py'], 'message': 'Finish factoring apart the graph_action module

Factor out the scheduling, running and completion components
of graph_action so that we can allow this to be plugged in with
other types of scheduling, running and completion strategies.

The newly added components are the following:

- A runtime container class (serves as a holder of some small
  utility functions) and all the other runtime components.
- A runner class that acts as the action engines run loop.
- A scheduler class that schedules nodes using a provided executor
  and returns futures that can be used to introspect there results as
  they complete.
- A completer class that completes nodes and futures that the
  scheduler started, persisting there results and doing any further
  post-execution analysis.

Part of blueprint plug-engine

Change-Id: I1dbf46654377fc34e9d90eeabf7b0062020bdc5e
'}]
commit_message:
Finish factoring apart the graph_action module

Factor out the scheduling, running and completion components
of graph_action so that we can allow this to be plugged in with
other types of scheduling, running and completion strategies.

The newly added components are the following:

- A runtime container class (serves as a holder of some small
  utility functions) and all the other runtime components.
- A runner class that acts as the action engines run loop.
- A scheduler class that schedules nodes using a provided executor
  and returns futures that can be used to introspect there results as
  they complete.
- A completer class that completes nodes and futures that the
  scheduler started, persisting there results and doing any further
  post-execution analysis.

Part of blueprint plug-engine

Change-Id: I1dbf46654377fc34e9d90eeabf7b0062020bdc5e

commit_message:
Removed duplication with list_user_ids_for_project

Keystone list_user_ids_for_project has the possibility of returning
duplicate users if the user has more than one role in the project.
list_user_ids_for_project queries the assignment table which has
one entry for every role the user has but will now remove
duplicate combinations of target_id and actor_id. This impacts
V2 calls for tenants.list_users(<tenant_id>) and
users.list(tenant_id=<tenant_id>).

Change-Id: I9a1e5b944c2c627138851976e81d405f54fae1c9
Closes-Bug: #1308218
(cherry picked from commit d6cb7043cb47f5e73b61635af596736314441275)

commit_message:
InvalidCPUInfo exception added to except block

When a live migration between two nodes with different
CPU info features is launched, an InvalidCPUInfo exception
is raised and not captured. That lets the vm in an
unusable state because the task_state rollback is not
executed.

Change-Id: Ib418fa324964cabd5f342d1b764f9ac7608b7ade
Closes-Bug: #1294210
(cherry picked from commit 7a3b4033f07f8c2144a36c1f12b1b9281cfb9a69)

- Stopping the service and restarting later, don't

Try:
- Stopping the service, sleep and restart

commit_message:
Cleanup openstack-common.conf and sync from olso

An upcoming change[1] in oslo's update.py adds new warnings for
style issues in the config. To compensate this commit:

 - orders the modules alphabetically
 - uses the script directive for scripts

Sync with oslo-incubator caed79d

This syncs Keystone with oslo-incubator commit hash
caed79d8239679cb74476bb0d9e5011b4fcc39da.

In keystone:

$ rm -r keystone/openstack/common

In oslo-incubator:

$ python update.py ../keystone

Commits
-------

1173e46 Remove ValueError when accessing sys.modules
17c4e21 Fix docstring indentation in systemd
90ae24b Remove redundant default=None for config options
6c7407b fileutils: port to Python 3
18f2bc1 Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()
af36c2a Fix logging setup for Python 3.4
5ae792b Document config generator variables
ea9ead8 Allow file exclusion in config generator
cdcc19c Mask passwords that are included in commands
9e5a393 jsonutils.load() accepts file pointer, not string
a6b2aec On Python <= 2.6, use simplejson if available
fe3389e Improve help strings
8a0f567 Remove str() from LOG.* and exceptions
f3f14c9 Fixed several typos
0f495ee Emit a log statement when releasing internal lock
9912e5d Add API for creating translation functions

1. https://review.openstack.org/76901

Change-Id: I89de9ae9e3c574095967a2a67e842a90b5527ffa

commit_message:
Sync oslo network utils

A new function was added to oslo-incubator for setting tcp keepalive
settings, and dependent projects can use it.

Ran update.py in oslo-incubator to copy changed modules into nova.
Removing synced changes for jsonutils because of issues with how
strings are encoded with simplejson that cause some of our unittests
to fail.

Changes are:
network_utils.py (which contains the function we need, others are deps)
edd73c9 Merge "Improve help strings"
fe3389e Improve help strings
8a0f567 Remove str() from LOG.* and exceptions
f61a4e7 Fix python26 compatibility for RFCSysLogHandler
da6d713 Revert setting oslo-incubator logs to INFO
0d18381 Set default log levels for oslo.messaging and oslo-incubator

gettextutils.py
9912e5d Add API for creating translation functions
6cc96d0 Fix test_gettextutils on Python 3

log.py
edd73c9 Merge "Improve help strings"
fe3389e Improve help strings
8a0f567 Remove str() from LOG.* and exceptions
f61a4e7 Fix python26 compatibility for RFCSysLogHandler
da6d713 Revert setting oslo-incubator logs to INFO
0d18381 Set default log levels for oslo.messaging and oslo-incubator

Current HEAD in OSLO:
----------------------------------------------
Merge: 2640847 e433899
Date:   Mon May 5 19:41:28 2014 +0000
Merge "Enable configuring tcp keepalive"
----------------------------------------------

Implements: blueprint configure-tcp-keepalive
Related-Bug: 1314129
Change-Id: Idd04ad4ad9a06ef76941dc5c1be41ac3ac8877a7

commit_message:
Restore formatting of _undercloud instructions

Somewhere in the past this block of instructions had its formatting
broken, leading it to it displaying inline without markup indicating it
as being a literal block of commands to run on the shell.

This change is intended to restore the formatting to match the other
instruction blocks.

Change-Id: I8a0a55cfa1c3a8ffc671fab14d09dca72e874690

commit_message:
Fixed Control and Network Node

Fixed network configurations under control and network node.

Updated service restart commands for better understanding and
transitions to the newer versions of ubuntu  which does not allow
traditional '/etc/init.d/<service> restart' commands.

blueprint training-manuals

Change-Id: I1d1e5ae0326977abd0caed5611554923b74b151c

commit_message:
Sync code with oslo-incubator

Updated openstack-common.conf and remove outdated modules. Ran update script
in oslo-incubator to generate modules in the mistral/openstack and tools
directories. Sqlalchemy backend has changed significantly in oslo-incubator.
Refactored mistral db api to address these changes and updated the base test
class DbTestCase accordingly.

Change-Id: I61327c33c0c8bc616af5e7633634461a2d7ac691
Implements: blueprint mistral-sync-with-incubator

commit_message:
debug level logs should not be translated

According to the OpenStack translation policy available at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LoggingStandards debug messages
should not be translated. Like mentioned in several changes in
Nova by garyk this is to help prioritize log translation.

Change-Id: Ia4de833da457b587f24f31b106802c92d2139af6

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2014-05-30 03:04:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/openstack-ops/ch_ops_upgrades.xml'], 'message': 'Adds instructions to upgrade Havana to Icehouse

Adds instructions to upgrade Havana to Icehouse in Ubuntu 12.04.4 LTS,
placed inside Operations/Upgrades, right below the Grizzly to Havana
upgrade instructions for RHEL.
These upgrade instructions intend to have similar formatting and steps
as the Grizzly->Havana ones, but taking into account the following:
- Be Havana->Icehouse specific;
- Considering Neutron as well;
- Considering the special and popular case of OVS to ML2 migration;
- Ubuntu 12.04 LTS only, _for now_.

Change-Id: I8d3cce0a2ceb306174c37d92382e201ff545be60
Closes-Bug: #1312660
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adds instructions to upgrade Havana to Icehouse

Adds instructions to upgrade Havana to Icehouse in Ubuntu 12.04.4 LTS,
placed inside Operations/Upgrades, right below the Grizzly to Havana
upgrade instructions for RHEL.
These upgrade instructions intend to have similar formatting and steps
as the Grizzly->Havana ones, but taking into account the following:
- Be Havana->Icehouse specific;
- Considering Neutron as well;
- Considering the special and popular case of OVS to ML2 migration;
- Ubuntu 12.04 LTS only, _for now_.

Change-Id: I8d3cce0a2ceb306174c37d92382e201ff545be60
Closes-Bug: #1312660
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-26 12:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/notifiers/nova.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/notifiers/test_notifiers_nova.py'], 'message': 'Replace loopingcall in notifier with a delayed send

The loopingcall thread here was started before processes fork and so
the thread stops working after the fork call.  This is a problem that
will probably need to be worked out in the long run.

To ensure that this notifier works correctly in all processes, this
change replaces the persistent loopingcall thread with a thread
created on demand to delay and batch up notifications.  The first
notification will trigger spawning the thread to wait to send it.  Any
notifications that come in the meantime will notice that there is
already a thread waiting to send and will return without spawning.

Conflicts:
        neutron/notifiers/nova.py

Change-Id: I519d4e89b8cee341c0e1cfffbce3e77151e8202a
Closes-Bug: #1301035
(cherry picked from commit 3be1d7a75c5ec754825e99e0a8d95b4e1521ae4b)
'}]
commit_message:
Replace loopingcall in notifier with a delayed send

The loopingcall thread here was started before processes fork and so
the thread stops working after the fork call.  This is a problem that
will probably need to be worked out in the long run.

To ensure that this notifier works correctly in all processes, this
change replaces the persistent loopingcall thread with a thread
created on demand to delay and batch up notifications.  The first
notification will trigger spawning the thread to wait to send it.  Any
notifications that come in the meantime will notice that there is
already a thread waiting to send and will return without spawning.

Conflicts:
        neutron/notifiers/nova.py

Change-Id: I519d4e89b8cee341c0e1cfffbce3e77151e8202a
Closes-Bug: #1301035
(cherry picked from commit 3be1d7a75c5ec754825e99e0a8d95b4e1521ae4b)

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 get_console_output
server action APIs response and validate the response with added
JSON schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of get_console_output V2 & V3 APIs is same and given
below:

{
        "output": "FAKE CONSOLE OUTPUT\nANOTHER\nLAST LINE"
}

Change-Id: I22e61d1fed926aa9a310a46b12748db401dec045

commit_message:
validate server action 'console_output' attributes

This patch adds the JSON schema for Nova V2 & V3 get_console_output
server action APIs response and validate the response with added
JSON schema to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

The response body of get_console_output V2 & V3 APIs is same and given
below:

{
        "output": "FAKE CONSOLE OUTPUT\nANOTHER\nLAST LINE"
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I22e61d1fed926aa9a310a46b12748db401dec045

subject: Fix tests with new keystoneclient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-29 20:16:07.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample', 'ironic/tests/api/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix tests with new keystoneclient

A number of changes with keystoneclient breaks our tests. First, a
kwarg changed for cache.set(). It should be 'time' now, not 'timeout'.

Also: keystone middleware now looks for an 'expires' in the token.

Sample conf needed regenerated, also, due to changes.

Change-Id: I33c4f1bae5a3c89b47fd21f8db1b4a4d536ed369
Closes-bug: 1324655
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tests with new keystoneclient

A number of changes with keystoneclient breaks our tests. First, a
kwarg changed for cache.set(). It should be 'time' now, not 'timeout'.

Also: keystone middleware now looks for an 'expires' in the token.

Sample conf needed regenerated, also, due to changes.

Change-Id: I33c4f1bae5a3c89b47fd21f8db1b4a4d536ed369
Closes-bug: 1324655

This is needed to avoid running pip install within the directory of

installs the test package, not pbr.

Change-Id: I956ad29f68a32cb4d33af448333f649043e0a655
'}]
commit_message:
Allow _run_cmd to run commands in any directory.

This is needed to avoid running pip install within the directory of
the test package on Python2.6, where it helpfully (not really)
installs the test package, not pbr.

Change-Id: I956ad29f68a32cb4d33af448333f649043e0a655

commit_message:
NSX: fix bug for flat provider network

The flat provider network would cause an exception when writing to
database. This is due to the fact that the DB expected an integer
and received an object instead.

Change-Id: Ib9d38711c0c2ef16d8bf74bfae44864a1bc272b1
Closes-bug: #1324120

commit_message:
Add nova_api_insecure flag to neutron

Neutron did not have any way to allow SSL validation problems in the
novaclient similar to the way nova has the neutron_api_insecure flag.
This change adds the nova_api_insecure flag to the neutron config and
also passes it in the novaclient instantiation.

Change-Id: Ifed581df253c01fab9dc1f22c8187876271b378e
Closes-Bug: #1306822
(cherry picked from commit a3e49885e7b7a69277a338f5d31e565e195b033c)

commit_message:
Fix for multiple misspelled words

In Nova code, few misspelled words have been found.
The misspellings python library has been used to scan
all nova code and find misspelled words.
This commit fixes all misspelled words found with this library.

Change-Id: I5919dddbbe812d8d32ecd8b249c1312249cd2a66
Closes-Bug: 1323730

subject: Sleep on iscsi logout to ensure successful delete
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-29 22:07:43.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py'], 'message': 'Sleep on iscsi logout to ensure successful delete

Similar to logging in, sleep for 3s on target logout. This
gives iscsiadm a chance to update its database, ensuring the

Change-Id: I37cf1c382cc0362c5efc8c62d8f37c57416c89be
Closes-Bug: #1324670
'}]
commit_message:
Sleep on iscsi logout to ensure successful delete

Similar to logging in, sleep for 3s on target logout. This
gives iscsiadm a chance to update its database, ensuring the
subsequent delete command succeeds without error.

Change-Id: I37cf1c382cc0362c5efc8c62d8f37c57416c89be
Closes-Bug: #1324670

commit_message:
Fixed wrong behavior when updating tenant or user with LDAP backends

User or tenent update request returns old value of field 'enabled'
when we use LDAP backends and flag tenant_enabled_emulation is True.

Closes-Bug: #1318927
Change-Id: I4b0c76a181e14a11df0cd14141abfdf78d4cedee

commit_message:
Adds a single threaded flow conductor

Creates a new conductor module that can be used
to connect into the jobboard, engine, and persistence
mechanism.

This commit adds in support for a simple conductor
that will run jobs in its own thread and will dispatch
them, and consume/abandon them.

Implements: blueprint generic-flow-conductor

Change-Id: Ic610bc825506db57b0c4364b0fc588b51d453a76

commit_message:
Make sure scoping to the project of a disabled domain result in 401.

Addresses the problem where we check for the validity of the scoped project,
we did not subsequently making sure its domain is also enabled.

Change-Id: I24e539aea9bb0ef0a22727fd9c1fb5d9d2ad1353
Closes-Bug: 1315556

subject: Start nova-conductor before nova-compute
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9009, 'name': 'Red Hat CI', 'email': 'redhatci@redhat.com', 'username': 'redhatci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-14 05:29:14.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'Start nova-conductor before nova-compute

nova-compute always starts with

  "2014-05-09 02:36:34.112 WARNING nova.conductor.api
  [req-98698a08-a3e0-4226-9ec2-f8f22ccf6262 None None] Timed out
  waiting for nova-conductor. Is it running? Or did this service start
  before nova-conductor?"

because it starts before nova-conductor.  Although the connection is
retried, this always leads to a 10-second timeout starting
nova-compute (see the code referenced in [1] for the backoff logic;
the change suggests making this situtation look less like an error).

To avoid this warning and timeout, we should start nova-conductor
first.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/93375/

Change-Id: I9c877b9acb0cf64aaddc64b8f3f2c27e12419559
'}]
commit_message:
Start nova-conductor before nova-compute

nova-compute always starts with

  "2014-05-09 02:36:34.112 WARNING nova.conductor.api
  [req-98698a08-a3e0-4226-9ec2-f8f22ccf6262 None None] Timed out
  waiting for nova-conductor. Is it running? Or did this service start
  before nova-conductor?"

because it starts before nova-conductor.  Although the connection is
retried, this always leads to a 10-second timeout starting
nova-compute (see the code referenced in [1] for the backoff logic;
the change suggests making this situtation look less like an error).

To avoid this warning and timeout, we should start nova-conductor
first.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/93375/

Change-Id: I9c877b9acb0cf64aaddc64b8f3f2c27e12419559

subject: Fixes arguments parsing when executing command
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8543, 'name': 'Lucian Petrut', 'email': 'lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'plucian'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-12 19:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/volumeutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes arguments parsing when executing command

A regression was caused by changing the eventlet.subprocess.Popen
with the builtin subprocess.Popen (by using the nova.utils execute
method) without changing the way the arguments were parsed.

In the v1 volume utilities module, the execution args were parsed
separated by whitespaces, which is not allowed by the builtin
subprocess.Popen, causing a "not found" error.

This error is returned for example when attaching a volume, at the
point where iscsicli tool is used to login the iSCSI target or portal.

This patch fixes the issue by simply splitting the args.

Closes-bug: #1317180

Change-Id: Iee7d5de0dde8b68d8f2bab4214e9b6779ad9f722
(cherry picked from commit 40a790c32ee4ea7b9d79e259545f07409fd618fa)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes arguments parsing when executing command

A regression was caused by changing the eventlet.subprocess.Popen
with the builtin subprocess.Popen (by using the nova.utils execute
method) without changing the way the arguments were parsed.

In the v1 volume utilities module, the execution args were parsed
separated by whitespaces, which is not allowed by the builtin
subprocess.Popen, causing a "not found" error.

This error is returned for example when attaching a volume, at the
point where iscsicli tool is used to login the iSCSI target or portal.

This patch fixes the issue by simply splitting the args.

Closes-bug: #1317180

Change-Id: Iee7d5de0dde8b68d8f2bab4214e9b6779ad9f722
(cherry picked from commit 40a790c32ee4ea7b9d79e259545f07409fd618fa)

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-29 03:28:02.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/common/test_storage_policies.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': "Allow to deprecate policy

if a policy is marked as 'deprecate = yes' in swift.conf:
    * it will not appear in /info of the cluster
    * upload/download/delete/post are allowed on the existing containers
      with this policy.
    * clients will get error when trying to create container with this policy
    * clients can get the policy info via HEAD on the existing
      containers created with this policy
    * clients also can set new metadata via POST to the containers with
      this policy

corner cases:
    * deprecated policy will ignore the default option
    * deprecating a default policy make the policy with the lowest index default

Change-Id: Ia72d39dca0c993e461e0e8cadef1dc91be98f3f4
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to deprecate policy

if a policy is marked as 'deprecate = yes' in swift.conf:
    * it will not appear in /info of the cluster
    * upload/download/delete/post are allowed on the existing containers
      with this policy.
    * clients will get error when trying to create container with this policy
    * clients can get the policy info via HEAD on the existing
      containers created with this policy
    * clients also can set new metadata via POST to the containers with
      this policy

corner cases:
    * deprecated policy will ignore the default option
    * deprecating a default policy make the policy with the lowest index default

Change-Id: Ia72d39dca0c993e461e0e8cadef1dc91be98f3f4

commit_message:
BrcdFCSanLookupService should allow customize host key and policy

In BrcdFCSanLookupService, the initialization should allow the
customization of the known_hosts_file and missing_key_policy so that the
hosts key and missing policy can be customized according to the
different scenario and customer aspect. This will not change the default
behavior when no argument is given, but more flexible to allow the
caller to give more options according to different requirements.

Closes-Bug: #1320050
Change-Id: If5767f63ccd2cde5fbea30a6154acf4d28f662b6
(cherry picked from commit 1eda138be81b2405969b80c00f30ba237e250fcd)

"}]
commit_message:
SSHPool in utils should allow customized host key missing policy

The cinder/utils SSHPool should allow  missing key policy and host key
file being customized so that any caller can determine by their own
scenario if the host key file can be customized, or if an 'AutoAdd' is
appropriate, or just reject the key when mismatch. This will give more
flexible customization and also prevent any security issue as a middle
man.

Closes-Bug: #1320056
Change-Id: I3c72b0d042de719ecd45429d376bd88d0aefb2cc
(cherry picked from commit 39081787963298be87c1941ab6cba5310f6261c6)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-15 01:41:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Exit early on stack/grenade failures

Grenade in particular has a good sanity check section, but if it fails
the wrapper script continues on to run tempest, etc.  This is very
confusing because you can get a lot of output and the issue is buried
deep in the logs.

Exiting at the point that stack or grenade fails will make this much
more obvious.

Change-Id: I0e0e6c044387f8dfa660e66c1968697c8178aa77
'}]
commit_message:
Exit early on stack/grenade failures

Grenade in particular has a good sanity check section, but if it fails
the wrapper script continues on to run tempest, etc.  This is very
confusing because you can get a lot of output and the issue is buried
deep in the logs.

Exiting at the point that stack or grenade fails will make this much
more obvious.

Change-Id: I0e0e6c044387f8dfa660e66c1968697c8178aa77

commit_message:
Miscellaneous doc fixes -- Part II

contents/contents-pre-install -- moved 4500-hardware to after vcenter
  section per David Easter

contents/contents-user -- moved vcenter before Fuel CLI section -- this
  is correct in the live build but, even after rebasing a couple times,
  was wrong here.

_images -- cropped the following:
- settings-vcenter

virtualbox.rst -- changed title to "Running MOST" rather than "Running Fuel"

release-notes.rst -- changed maxdepth back to 2; David didn't like seeing
all the issues listed out.

release-notes
- 040-resolved-issues -- David does not like grouping all the known
  hardware issues into a single section so I backed out what I had
  started to do -- deleted the header and changed the heading leve
  for the individual issues.
- 050-known-issues
  - removed duplicated "other issue" about ceph mon and ceph osd; it was wrong
    because it talked about the ceph mon role which is not yet supported.

terminology
- Updated Murano article with info from the Release Notes about requiring
  Neutron

user-guide/200-deploy-new-environment
- Hypervisor section now points to vcenter config info
- vcenter config info now references hypervisor section

user-guide/vcenter.rst -- made the instructions point to the
Hypervisor screen and the vCenter configuration screen and
corrected the description of where these are.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary coding line

As per PEP 263, a Python file with non-ASCII characters must have a
line with "coding: <some-encoding>". This file is pure ASCII, so the
line is unnecessary here.

Change-Id: I1cade3ddc7ef9631a5230bd00bafc64979cbf80a

commit_message:
Make default nova_url use a version

The default nova_url for neutron is missing an API
version number. This can cause requests to fail
because the Nova /versions API cannot respond
to Neutron notification requests.

It seems reasonable for the default value to
at least have a chance at being correct so
this patch upgrades the default Nova API url to
use the Nova 'v2' API.

Related-bug: #1298640
Change-Id: Ib1449de84fbc01fb704ebfe4a016ac8f4932be96
(cherry picked from commit c09a14089a5ca7cd3093895ee0248876499a6d06)

commit_message:
Make encoding.serialize() more programmatical

Introduce `serializable_fields` to express which class attributes
to be serialized.

Get rid of OrderedDict. Just replacing it with regular dict.

Change-Id: I3f7639dab171d3d62e92d0d1bb6d7b071cf963ad

is not editable (i.e. inline_edit_available is False or update_allowed is
False).

This patch add that missing code and some tests to ensure wrap_list works as
expected.

Change-Id: I261c345790b4dd2c8c6865d98e6ddad136ae1a72
Closes-Bug: #1316666
'}]
commit_message:
wrap_list is not honored for not-editable cells

wrap_list attribute is used to add an enclosing <ul> tag to table cell
content.
_data_table_cell.html lacks the code to add that element if the cell content
is not editable (i.e. inline_edit_available is False or update_allowed is
False).

This patch add that missing code and some tests to ensure wrap_list works as
expected.

Change-Id: I261c345790b4dd2c8c6865d98e6ddad136ae1a72
Closes-Bug: #1316666

subject: Copy rsrc_metadata before modifying
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-19 23:22:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Copy rsrc_metadata before modifying

The root cause of bug #1320262 appears to be that serialised json
is written out with different key orders, which unnecessarily
triggers the os-collect-config change hashing detection.

This appears to be some unusual interaction with modifying the
sqlalchemy Json field, so this change modifies a dict copy
of rsrc_metadata instead.

Change-Id: Ie9e442e7595fbe163bf6c3e4af1f9d52babf1474
Closes-Bug: #1320262
'}]
commit_message:
Copy rsrc_metadata before modifying

The root cause of bug #1320262 appears to be that serialised json
is written out with different key orders, which unnecessarily
triggers the os-collect-config change hashing detection.

This appears to be some unusual interaction with modifying the
sqlalchemy Json field, so this change modifies a dict copy
of rsrc_metadata instead.

Change-Id: Ie9e442e7595fbe163bf6c3e4af1f9d52babf1474
Closes-Bug: #1320262

commit_message:
Refactor test_rescue_unrescue into compute api/manager unit tests

As part of converting the rescue/unrescue compute API flows to using
objects, i.e. dot notation for accessing attributes on the instance
object and updating the database via instance.save() rather than
compute_api.update, we want to move some of the integration-style tests
found in test_compute.py to test_compute_api.py and test_compute_mgr.py.

This is to help with the conversion so we don't have to use exotic stubs
in the cells API flows to make integration tests work.

This change is mainly concerned with moving test_rescue_unrescue out of
test_compute.py and into the api/manager specific test modules and then
later changes will build on top of the new tests.

Part of blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I2a9b1c6b5a1f41272e26c20de134a2a8b71c88f3

There are many RPC options that cinder gets from
oslo.messaging instead of common.rpc, as well as many
options that we leave commented out that take up space and
can be confusing since we don't configure them with attributes.
Clean these up, as well as fixing a crazy amount of unnecessary

Change-Id: I46ff3d8dd57527e46608cd31a0c80cee9cfe18ae
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up RPC options in cinder.conf.erb

There are many RPC options that cinder gets from
oslo.messaging instead of common.rpc, as well as many
options that we leave commented out that take up space and
can be confusing since we don't configure them with attributes.
Clean these up, as well as fixing a crazy amount of unnecessary
double quotes.

This should have no functional change.

Change-Id: I46ff3d8dd57527e46608cd31a0c80cee9cfe18ae

commit_message:
VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when instance is deleted

If the user creates a rescue instance and then proceeded to delete
the original instance then the rescue instance would still be up
and running on the backend.

This patch ensures that the rescue instance is cleaned up if
necessary.

The vmops unrescue method has a new parameter indicating if
the original VM should be powered on.

Closes-bug: 1269418
(cherry picked from commit efb66531bc37ee416778a70d46c657608ca767af)

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I3c1d0b1d003392b306094b80ea1ac99377441fbf

commit_message:
xenapi: move StorageError into global exception.py

We have our own exception for StorageErrors, and this is causing some
interesting dependency issues, so seems best to move this exception into
the more usual place.

Change-Id: I4f1f33e95f1050874ef828af9b35b0edbf8f0176

commit_message:
Verify delete security group response of V2 API

This patch adds the JSON schema for response status of Nova security group
delete API to block the backward incompatibility change in the future.

delete security group does not return the response body.
Response status of this API is 202.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

commit_message:
change assert(Not)Equals to assert(Not)Equal

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assert(Not)Equals is a deprecated alias of assert(Not)Equal.
Enabled H234 check.

Change-Id: I201559be7ab038889f585f5d20fd1a2c6f606182

fixing

Change-Id: Ib21e0dc5751a0e938f209138cec8b37e03626bff

commit_message:
Fix KeyError exception while updating dhcp port

This is caused by a missing network_id in the port body.
This patch adds it so that a warning message can be traced
correctly. Wording is slightly tweaked to ensure it applies
to the right context.

Closes-bug: #1324194

Change-Id: I4b67b5c3584aa33278eb0e9e879ca338ba0ca8b0

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-28 00:12:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/default-quotas.rst'], 'message': "Manage the default quotas through the API

This blueprint allows the operators to update and show the default
quotas through the nova API.

Currently an operator is not able neither to show nor to update the
default quotas trough the nova API, it has to be done through
configuration.

This blueprint proposes to use the current quotas API to define the
default quotas by sending 'defaults' instead of the tenant_id.

Related to blueprint default-quotas

Change-Id: I2bec4d9da93db2d85547bfa979f480f0ba0d5b13
"}]
commit_message:
Manage the default quotas through the API

This blueprint allows the operators to update and show the default
quotas through the nova API.

Currently an operator is not able neither to show nor to update the
default quotas trough the nova API, it has to be done through
configuration.

This blueprint proposes to use the current quotas API to define the
default quotas by sending 'defaults' instead of the tenant_id.

Related to blueprint default-quotas

Change-Id: I2bec4d9da93db2d85547bfa979f480f0ba0d5b13

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-28 20:38:50.000000000', 'files': ['spec/common_spec.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb', 'recipes/common.rb', 'files/default/policy.json'], 'message': "Remove policy.json file

Implements: blueprint remove-policy-templates
Closes-Bug: #1324187

commit_message:
Remove policy.json file

The policy file is just a dup of what's already in the distro
packages.  Until the cookbooks/chef support a policy type resource
duping them does not make sense and causes churn to keep in sync
with base openstack code.

Change-Id: Ib09d5efdf3927a381501eebd78d5c4db5133f057
Implements: blueprint remove-policy-templates
Closes-Bug: #1324187

Use the nova_client.networks manager to find a network. The sample uses

commit_message:
SDK: Improve the instance creation

Use the nova_client.networks manager to find a network. The sample uses
a 'private' network as created by devstack.

Also rename the 'nic_d' variable 'nics' since it's a list and not a
dict.

Change-Id: I85e53497613421b4bcf604d6033ea31a1be1d020

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-26 08:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/cinder-common.rb', 'spec/cinder_common_spec.rb'], 'message': "Make retrieval of vmware_host_pass optional

Before this change, a non-vmware user would (without developer mode)
have to create a data bag item for this pass even when not using it,
because otherwise the get_secret's call would fail.

Plus, it's more in line with the other drivers.

Change-Id: I48a6e23d6aa9abd106e65e70b40662c8d4cca5fc
"}]
commit_message:
Make retrieval of vmware_host_pass optional

Before this change, a non-vmware user would (without developer mode)
have to create a data bag item for this pass even when not using it,
because otherwise the get_secret's call would fail.

Plus, it's more in line with the other drivers.

Implements: blueprint vmware-password-databag
Change-Id: I48a6e23d6aa9abd106e65e70b40662c8d4cca5fc

subject: Make retrieval of vmware_host_pass optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-26 10:19:09.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'spec/api_spec.rb', 'recipes/api.rb'], 'message': 'Make retrieval of vmware_host_pass optional

Before this change, a non-vmware user would (without developer mode)
have to create a data bag item for this pass even when not using it,
because otherwise the get_secret's call would fail.

Now the lookup happens when the vmware_server_host is set, which seams
quite reasonable (I couldn't make out a "real" config driver switch to
put there instead.)

Also did some refactoring of the vmware specs into a parameterised
shared_examples block, with some additions.

Implements: blueprint vmware-password-databag
Change-Id: I8b34ef11eb01a668eddc41894d10c7c240f56e21
'}]
commit_message:
Make retrieval of vmware_host_pass optional

Before this change, a non-vmware user would (without developer mode)
have to create a data bag item for this pass even when not using it,
because otherwise the get_secret's call would fail.

Now the lookup happens when the vmware_server_host is set, which seams
quite reasonable (I couldn't make out a "real" config driver switch to
put there instead.)

Also did some refactoring of the vmware specs into a parameterised
shared_examples block, with some additions.

Implements: blueprint vmware-password-databag
Change-Id: I8b34ef11eb01a668eddc41894d10c7c240f56e21

commit_message:
Remove admin_metadata from regular users view

Recently it was observed that with large numbers of volumes
that things like "cinder list" could take extremely long to
return.

For example, running cinder list on a system with 1000 volumes took
greater than 30 seconds to return.  It turns out that the cause of
this is the addition of visible admin_metadata.

There's two problems with this:
1. The original patch probably shouldn't have gone in
   data is either admin data or it's not, selectively picking
   pieces of admin data out to provide to the user just creates
   complications and introduces confusion.
2. The REAL issue here is that since the standar gets are made
   with the standard user context, the add_visible_admin_metadata
   would go through and do an elevated context get on every single
   volume individually.  This is what caused the horrible performance
   issue on cinder list with large numbers of volumes.

Running as admin, or removing the second call drops this down to about 3
seconds for the same 1000 volume list.

This patch removes the secondary admin context get_call.  Instead where
we expect to do display the visible admin_meta, we go ahead and elevate
the context so the returned object actually has the right entries.

This creates some issues with migration views, which are set to key
on is_admin context.  To fix that we introduce a flag to the get_all
call that tells the migration code if this is REALLY in fact an admin
and thus preseving the behavior.

For now, to fix the performance issue and offer a clean backport we're
going to keep the viewable admin_meta, however long term this needs to
be revisited.

Finally; the V2 API was refactored to use a common add_visible_metadata
method to cinder.utils.py.  Sadly however V1 wasn't updated to use this.
Since this method needed changed and was the root of the bug, this patch
also refactors the V1 code to use the same cinder.utils method as V2.

Change-Id: Ifbd8e3031f0a89e09a8a7be8d6e906616b906420
Closes-Bug: 1317606

In case nova server has quotas turned off, e.g. when it uses

obviously means 'INFINITY'. In this case we should not check resource

commit_message:
Ignore nova limits set to '-1'

In case nova server has quotas turned off, e.g. when it uses
NoopQuotaDriver, nova-api returns '-1' for corresponding resources which
obviously means 'INFINITY'. In this case we should not check resource
template for any limits and should pass resource creation as-is.

Change-Id: Idaf485719e384f3a613031c7ff272d55798e6e77
Closes-Bug: #1310710
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Borodaenko <dborodaenko@mirantis.com>

The OVS lib deferred apply methods use a dict to save flows to add,

commit_message:
OVS lib defer apply doesn't handle concurrency

The OVS lib deferred apply methods use a dict to save flows to add,
modify or delete when deffered apply is switched off.
If another thread adds, modifies or deletes flows on that dict during
another process called deffered_apply_off, its flows could be ignored.

This fix stash reference flows list and point the flows list to a new
cleared flows list. Then, it applies flows from the stashed flows list.

Closes-bug: #1263866
(cherry picked from commit 501213686886baccd3280e10b8856a25d3517519)

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I3b22c7ec055934d7f30067924c7a7fd71b2f6081

commit_message:
L3 RPC loop could delete a router on concurrent update

routers_updated does not acquire any lock just updates
a set for future rpc loop processing.

The self.updated_routers can be changed by concurrent update
notification. If this change happens at the time around the
self.plugin_rpc.get_routers call, the additional routers
- by mistake - is considered as admin_state_up=false routers, which
 are safe to delete.

Creating a local copy of the updated_routers and preserve
the fresh updated_routers entries for the next _rpc_loop
operations.

Change-Id: Icc7377f9c29e248c3b34562465e859b15ecc2ec3
Closes-Bug: #1315467
Partial-Bug: #1253896
(cherry picked from commit 45381fe1c742c75773d97f1c0bd1f3cb1e7a6468)

commit_message:
NEC plugin: Bump L3RPC callback version to 1.1

update_floatingip_statuses RPC call implemented in Icehouse expects
RPC version 1.1 and RPC version of L3RpcCallback of other plugins
was bumped to 1.1, but the version of L3RpcCallback in NEC plugin
was not bumped to 1.1 yet.

Change-Id: I0073a3de9ea0cd59d43c821f9bdaea89bd125a65
Closes-Bug: #1323769
(cherry picked from commit e588ee5b470bdca25abc634db3144d2aa9b84554)

subject: Use Emacs-friendly file variable to set file encoding
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-28 08:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/api/middleware/fault.py'], 'message': 'Use Emacs-friendly file variable to set file encoding

The file encoding line serves a dual purpose: it informs both Python
and Emacs about the file encoding.

PEP 263 explains that a file with non-ASCII characters must specify an
encoding. Without an encoding line, importing the file will raise a
SyntaxError.

The problem is now that while Python will accept both of

  -*- encoding: <some-encoding> -*-
  -*- coding: <some-encoding> -*-

and Emacs only accepts the latter since it looks for a file variable
named "coding", not "encoding". Since the Emacs specific "-*-" syntax
is already used, it seems right to use the correct variable for Emacs.

Change-Id: If5321ac2fad595c529aa3ec5f2852aa71458834b
'}]
commit_message:
Use Emacs-friendly file variable to set file encoding

The file encoding line serves a dual purpose: it informs both Python
and Emacs about the file encoding.

PEP 263 explains that a file with non-ASCII characters must specify an
encoding. Without an encoding line, importing the file will raise a
SyntaxError.

The problem is now that while Python will accept both of

  -*- encoding: <some-encoding> -*-
  -*- coding: <some-encoding> -*-

and Emacs only accepts the latter since it looks for a file variable
named "coding", not "encoding". Since the Emacs specific "-*-" syntax
is already used, it seems right to use the correct variable for Emacs.

Change-Id: If5321ac2fad595c529aa3ec5f2852aa71458834b

commit_message:
Add Hitachi storage volume driver installation guide v2

Changes from v1
 - Fix reviewer's comments as below.
   - Move table to doc/common/tables/cinder-hitachi.xml.
   - Remove a simple paragraph for each item.
   - Remove extra whitespace after </listitem>.
   - Use <screen><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>...</userinput>
     instead of <programlisting>.
   - Use <option>/<command>.
   - Move a table to common/tables/cinder-hitachi.xml.
   - Change Cinder service to Block Storage service.
   - Use <screen><computeroutput> instead of<programlisting>.

 - Also, there are additional fixes as follows.
   - Add VSP GP1000 as a supported storage
   - Make Copy-on-Write Snapshot optional. (Storage License)
   - Move "if group_request is not yes" at the begining of a sentence
     to make the meaning clear. (Set up Hitachi storage)
   - Remove unneeded installation steps (creating user/directries)

Implements: add-hitachi-block-storage-driver

Change-Id: Ic3ba79d929ba059c2faf05707cc615e456ab6aa0
Signed-off-by: Seiji Aguchi <seiji.aguchi.tr@hitachi.com>

subject: Add note to keystone db_sync to check for success.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-21 21:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_keystone-install.xml'], 'message': 'Add note to keystone db_sync to check for success.

Add an additional note after the db_sync command that this command
may return a critical error and fail to fully migrate an empty
repository.  This is probably due to the fact that the upgrade
scripts do not guard against transaction failures returned from the
SQL server. You need to run this command multiple times and check
"keystone-manage db_version". If it does not reach version 44, the
upgrade scripts have not completed for Icehouse builds.

Closes-Bug: #1297290
Change-Id: Ibbd832d8d56fa820d7e0d0eefaa61e3728bab023
'}]
commit_message:
Add note to keystone db_sync to check for success.

Add an additional note after the db_sync command that this command
may return a critical error and fail to fully migrate an empty
repository.  This is probably due to the fact that the upgrade
scripts do not guard against transaction failures returned from the
SQL server. You need to run this command multiple times and check
"keystone-manage db_version". If it does not reach version 44, the
upgrade scripts have not completed for Icehouse builds.

Closes-Bug: #1297290
Change-Id: Ibbd832d8d56fa820d7e0d0eefaa61e3728bab023

subject: Container Confict on obj update with wrong Storage-Policy-Index
revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2014-04-17 17:12:15.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_replicator.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/common/test_db.py', 'swift/common/storage_policy.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py', 'swift/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Container Confict on obj update with wrong Storage-Policy-Index

The container server knows its storage policy index by looking in the
container_stat table.  When an object update comes in to the container server,
there is an X-Storage-Policy-Index header in the incoming request, or it's
implicitly 0 during an upgrade. If the submitted X-Storage-Policy-Index
doesn't match the container's policy index, reject the request with a 409
Conflict response.

By doing this, we ensure that we know the policy of every object in a
container: it's the same as the container. If it doesn't match, it doesn't get
in. This makes reconciling two disagreeing container DBs possible.

Additionally we encode the policy index into the pending file to maintain
speed in put_object without having to acctually open the database and check
the storage policy in the stats table.  Benchmarking showed the extra get_info
call in put_object slowed the operation down by ~70%.  In this implementation
the storage_policy_index is only checked when a) creating the .pending_file
that doesn't already exist and b) merging the .pending_file.  Since the file
is truncated at merge (rather than removed) this is a onetime setup for the
database before put_object can start streaming in.  This change requires
_commit_puts to know the location of the pending file, and a base
implementation to move the .pending_file attribute to a property was added to
the common DatabaseBroker.  In the base implementation it's just a passthrough
to the existing base ._pending_file attribute.  For the ContainerBroker every
time commit_puts is called we poll the stats table to lookup the
storage_policy_index.  Because the commit_puts call is expected to hit the
stats table anyway during triggers this change was expected to not have
noticable impact on merge throughput and indeed benchmarking confirmed.

Implements: blueprint storage-policies
Change-Id: I3576f830f502229065d48f03ae9f45e2331aa8fa
"}]
commit_message:
Container Confict on obj update with wrong Storage-Policy-Index

The container server knows its storage policy index by looking in the
container_stat table.  When an object update comes in to the container server,
there is an X-Storage-Policy-Index header in the incoming request, or it's
implicitly 0 during an upgrade. If the submitted X-Storage-Policy-Index
doesn't match the container's policy index, reject the request with a 409
Conflict response.

By doing this, we ensure that we know the policy of every object in a
container: it's the same as the container. If it doesn't match, it doesn't get
in. This makes reconciling two disagreeing container DBs possible.

Additionally we encode the policy index into the pending file to maintain
speed in put_object without having to acctually open the database and check
the storage policy in the stats table.  Benchmarking showed the extra get_info
call in put_object slowed the operation down by ~70%.  In this implementation
the storage_policy_index is only checked when a) creating the .pending_file
that doesn't already exist and b) merging the .pending_file.  Since the file
is truncated at merge (rather than removed) this is a onetime setup for the
database before put_object can start streaming in.  This change requires
_commit_puts to know the location of the pending file, and a base
implementation to move the .pending_file attribute to a property was added to
the common DatabaseBroker.  In the base implementation it's just a passthrough
to the existing base ._pending_file attribute.  For the ContainerBroker every
time commit_puts is called we poll the stats table to lookup the
storage_policy_index.  Because the commit_puts call is expected to hit the
stats table anyway during triggers this change was expected to not have
noticable impact on merge throughput and indeed benchmarking confirmed.

Implements: blueprint storage-policies
Change-Id: I3576f830f502229065d48f03ae9f45e2331aa8fa

commit_message:
Fix neutron ml2 procedure

In Debian, debconf takes care of selecting the correct plug-in, and
there is no specific plug-in packages (they are all contained within
python-neutron and neutron-common). This patch fixes the procedure
for Debian, and also displays the screenshot which was removed
somehow.

Note: this is a backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95454/
without a single modification.

Change-Id: Ic50d40951e37ee41c118d980ae648f12906d8add

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-28 14:18:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py'], 'message': "Add unit test trap for object change detection

This adds a test that compares each object to a known hash that
covers the list of remotable method signatures and the field
definitions. Storing this in the code helps us assert that our object
definitions have not changed without a version bump. If someone
adds or changes a field or method to an object, this test will
fail, reminding them to bump the version and update the hash.

This adds a 'remotable' attribute to the methods decorated as such
so that we can detect them separately from local methods which
do not need a version bump.

Change-Id: I3e8bd387e36cec406baf4c6933baca9e1663d122
"}]
commit_message:
Add unit test trap for object change detection

This adds a test that compares each object to a known hash that
covers the list of remotable method signatures and the field
definitions. Storing this in the code helps us assert that our object
definitions have not changed without a version bump. If someone
adds or changes a field or method to an object, this test will
fail, reminding them to bump the version and update the hash.

This adds a 'remotable' attribute to the methods decorated as such
so that we can detect them separately from local methods which
do not need a version bump.

Change-Id: I3e8bd387e36cec406baf4c6933baca9e1663d122

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-05-23 10:48:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/migrate_server.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'nova/tests/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/admin_actions.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrate_server.py'], 'message': 'Ensure live-migrate reverts if server not running

When the check to ensure a VM is running before attempting the
live migrate fails, it raises InstanceNotRunning. It should really be
treated in the same way as MigrationPreCheckError.

Along with fixing this bug, I have ensured the expected exceptions in
migrate_server are in sync with the except clause in _live_migrate.

This goes through to the API, ensuring the errors are not treated as
internal server errors, but are given a slightly more appropriate error
return value.

Currently the API returns 400 for all these kinds of errors. While other
error codes may be more appropriate, this change is concentrating purely
on ensuring we treat all the exceptions in the same way.

Change-Id: Iafe5026ef5a095d76e9864b489571e7bcfeb55f0
Closes-Bug: #1312132
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure live-migrate reverts if server not running

When the check to ensure a VM is running before attempting the
live migrate fails, it raises InstanceNotRunning. It should really be
treated in the same way as MigrationPreCheckError.

Along with fixing this bug, I have ensured the expected exceptions in
migrate_server are in sync with the except clause in _live_migrate.

This goes through to the API, ensuring the errors are not treated as
internal server errors, but are given a slightly more appropriate error
return value.

Currently the API returns 400 for all these kinds of errors. While other
error codes may be more appropriate, this change is concentrating purely
on ensuring we treat all the exceptions in the same way.

Change-Id: Iafe5026ef5a095d76e9864b489571e7bcfeb55f0
Closes-Bug: #1312132

commit_message:
Unbreak translations

Our translation tools do not handle xlink:show correctly. There is
only instance and we do not really need it here, so remove it.

Also <para xlink:href=.. is not supported, remove the it, it's not
needed either.

Change-Id: I46ff06d30929e8894c517860b603f69f41772562

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-05-29 02:07:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/common/constants.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py'], 'message': "Reprogram flows when ovs-vswitchd restarts

When OVS is restarted, by default it will not reprogram flows which were
programmed. For the case of the OVS agent, this means a restart will cause
all traffic to be switched using the NORMAL action. This is undesirable for
a number of reasons, including obvious security reasons.

This change provides a way for the agent to check if a restart of ovs-vswitchd
has happened in the main agent loop. If a restart of ovs-vswitchd is detected,
the agent will run through the setup of the bridges on the host and reprogram
flows for all the ports connected.

DocImpact
This changes adds a new table (table 23) to the integration bridge, with a
single 'drop' flow. This is used to monitor OVS restarts and to reprogram
flows from the agent.

Change-Id: If9e07465c43115838de23e12a4e0087c9218cea2
Closes-Bug: #1290486
"}]
commit_message:
Reprogram flows when ovs-vswitchd restarts

When OVS is restarted, by default it will not reprogram flows which were
programmed. For the case of the OVS agent, this means a restart will cause
all traffic to be switched using the NORMAL action. This is undesirable for
a number of reasons, including obvious security reasons.

This change provides a way for the agent to check if a restart of ovs-vswitchd
has happened in the main agent loop. If a restart of ovs-vswitchd is detected,
the agent will run through the setup of the bridges on the host and reprogram
flows for all the ports connected.

DocImpact
This changes adds a new table (table 23) to the integration bridge, with a
single 'drop' flow. This is used to monitor OVS restarts and to reprogram
flows from the agent.

Change-Id: If9e07465c43115838de23e12a4e0087c9218cea2
Closes-Bug: #1290486

commit_message:
Use error instead of warning to log mount exc

Gluster's driver uses warning to log mount exceptions. This patch
replaces that warning with an error message.

Change-Id: I54a10ec8abf460ca9ff7bb009b8d702cfad0fed0
Closes-Bug: #1317573

There is currently an issue with building fedora 20 images
that are selinux enabled. This change modifies the instructions
for building a software-config image to include the
selinux-permissive element, which allows image building to

Change-Id: Ib67dc5a30a4e1f25e282efbfefc89dd816f7be4e
Related-Bug: #1316241
'}]
commit_message:
Include selinux-permissive element for fedora

There is currently an issue with building fedora 20 images
that are selinux enabled. This change modifies the instructions
for building a software-config image to include the
selinux-permissive element, which allows image building to
complete.

Change-Id: Ib67dc5a30a4e1f25e282efbfefc89dd816f7be4e
Related-Bug: #1316241

commit_message:
Change conductor to cast to build_and_run_instance

With build_and_run_instance taking over for run_instance in the compute
manager, this switches over to calling it.  With this change the build
process will not cast back to the scheduler on a build retry.

This is the final part of a series of patches to build up the
build_and_run_instance method.

bp remove-cast-to-schedule-run-instance
Change-Id: Iefab71047996b7cc08107794d5bc628c11680a70

commit_message:
versions API: ignore request with a body

Update the OS API versions controller so it ignores requests
with a body. Previously an incoming (unauthenticated)
request to the versions API would log a TypeError trace
in the nova-api.log file with the following message:

TypeError: index() got an unexpected keyword argument 'body'

Change-Id: Icc3ccfc537b13627b8d5ba43ae3ba91e34e08c9e
Closes-bug: #1306727

commit_message:
Add Marconi Smoke Tests

Add smoke tests that check the existence of queues.
Add test that checks list queues.
Add test that gets queue statistics.
Add test that sets and gets queue metadata.

Tests for List Queues and Queue Stats use JSON Schema
validation.

Change-Id: I084d1ae0de4a729a913a7084f14c0d3172af29d3
Implements: blueprint add-basic-marconi-tests

subject: Fix sudo_cmd_call in tempest.common.commands
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7293, 'name': 'Elena Ezhova', 'email': 'ezhovaelena19@gmail.com', 'username': 'elena'}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-27 13:47:12.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/commands.py'], 'message': 'Fix sudo_cmd_call in tempest.common.commands

The check that proc.returncode is non-zero was never executed
because it was located after the return statement.

Moreover, subprocess.CalledProcessError may only be raised by
a process run by check_call() or check_output()
but not by communicate().

Change-Id: I5fdcdcdda85552e5855241ada34054cfda8464d5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sudo_cmd_call in tempest.common.commands

The check that proc.returncode is non-zero was never executed
because it was located after the return statement.

Moreover, subprocess.CalledProcessError may only be raised by
a process run by check_call() or check_output()
but not by communicate().

Change-Id: I5fdcdcdda85552e5855241ada34054cfda8464d5

node-show to show the instance_info field

The commit 7735ad404bb2849f5be738c2f8a536b1f817c6b7 for Ironic introduced
a new instance_info field to Nodes, this patch is adding the field to
be shown as part of the node-show command.

commit_message:
Fixes installation of test-requirements

pip install fails because the "-f http...pysendfile.2.0.0.tar.gz"
returns 404. pip will install pysendfile 2.0.0 without defining
the url.

Ref: http://code.google.com/p/pysendfile/issues/detail?id=20&can=1

Closes bug 1314968

Change-Id: I15baf378b37841f8abb21294efebe2dee95077c3
(cherry picked from commit ed816a214be8acc17d75f68e6c2552fd3b1ad56f)

commit_message:
Allow database connection options

Telemetry db2 case uses nosql connection string and this might
require additional connection options, like ?socketTimeoutMS=200
Added ability to specify db options for all db backends.

Change-Id: I41a577200824a7a5f0b735207df9596d92d034c9
Closes-bug: #1323733

set all build_intervals to 1s

10s build interval is really long, and not very sensible. Setting
to 1s should speed things up a lot.

Change-Id: If8332d4be8515ac574cbbf4e00cbe0a75b6ebc5d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 17:53:15.000000000', 'files': ['etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Remove default from image_ref options

This commit removes the weird default values for the image_ref option.
The IMAGE_ID defaults were probably a hold away from when they were

Change-Id: Iaeff5ff2278b0076306ed2cbfe592c06cfbbe316

commit_message:
Remove default from image_ref options

This commit removes the weird default values for the image_ref option.
The IMAGE_ID defaults were probably a hold away from when they were
set in env from an early version of tempest. This sets no default and
lists them as required opts in the help field.

Change-Id: Iaeff5ff2278b0076306ed2cbfe592c06cfbbe316

commit_message:
Use stack lock context manager in delete_stack

This will ensure that the stack lock is always released when there is an
exception.

Use stack lock context manager in abandon_stack

This will ensure that the stack lock is always released when there is an
exception.

subject: Slight modification to the object updater sweep code
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-15 01:01:45.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': "Slight modification to the object updater sweep code

In preparation for proposing the meat of storage policies to
master, we're taking small and harmless portions that may not
always appear to add value now but they will when storage
policies come in and geting them in now will minimize the size
of upcoming merges.

In this change, we're changing the name of ASYNCDIR to
ASYNCDIR_BASE as policies will have multiple async directory
names (one per policy).  In the object updater rather than just
looking for the one name 'asyncdir' we set the stage for looping
on all subdirs looking for things that start with ASYNCDIR_BASE
and moving on to the next dir if its not a match.  Introduction
of this code to master now adds no new functionality; one small
block of code will be merged later to actually match on names
other than ASYNCDIR_BASE and do the right thing.

Change-Id: I655d2f2fdadc050ad95af5d1237ebe828b06701a
Implements: blueprint storage-policies
"}]
commit_message:
Slight modification to the object updater sweep code

In preparation for proposing the meat of storage policies to
master, we're taking small and harmless portions that may not
always appear to add value now but they will when storage
policies come in and geting them in now will minimize the size
of upcoming merges.

In this change, we're changing the name of ASYNCDIR to
ASYNCDIR_BASE as policies will have multiple async directory
names (one per policy).  In the object updater rather than just
looking for the one name 'asyncdir' we set the stage for looping
on all subdirs looking for things that start with ASYNCDIR_BASE
and moving on to the next dir if its not a match.  Introduction
of this code to master now adds no new functionality; one small
block of code will be merged later to actually match on names
other than ASYNCDIR_BASE and do the right thing.

Change-Id: I655d2f2fdadc050ad95af5d1237ebe828b06701a
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

commit_message:
Extend CLI functionality

Adds some CLI functionality to murano CLI
 - environment show, create, delete, rename
 - deployment list
 - category list
 - package list, download, import, show, delete
Updates openstack-common, adds jsonutils and timeutils

Partially implements: blueprint murano-cli-client

Change-Id: I66215f56bcf8eba3329803650e70437175c49376
