commit_message:
Use service account for Glance with Swift

If Swift is being used, this patch will enable Glance to create
a service account in Swift. This also requires passing a service
token to swiftclient.

Change-Id: I436ea89c6bf5435c7b04ad8ddedc45725034e2c7
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/backing-store-for-trusted-services

commit_message:
Allow swiftclient to handle service token and name

Services operating on a user's behalf may specify a service
namespace (replacing the reseller prefix) which requires a
service token to also be passed with each request.

Change-Id: Ic367e4fa69f33f0e30b34f3bcce1fde73533bad7

commit_message:
Add privileged service accounts

Adds support for accounts which start with a string identifying
the service. A request for an account which is identified to be
a service account also requires the privilegedservice role.

Change-Id: Ieb3fee50c4f46ec183c18e7fcfac027bc74bae1c
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/backing-store-for-trusted-services

subject: Accept X-Service-Token in auth_token middlewatre
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-28 20:01:23.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py'], 'message': "Accept X-Service-Token in auth_token middlewatre

The X-Service-Token header has been added to allow services
to authenticate on behalf of a user operation. The service token
is validated and the roles are appended to the list of roles obtained
from the user's auth token.

Change-Id: Icd99395f3beaa4977f612ef3187b2dabf709e9d1
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/backing-store-for-trusted-services
"}]
commit_message:
Accept X-Service-Token in auth_token middlewatre

The X-Service-Token header has been added to allow services
to authenticate on behalf of a user operation. The service token
is validated and the roles are appended to the list of roles obtained
from the user's auth token.

Change-Id: Icd99395f3beaa4977f612ef3187b2dabf709e9d1
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/backing-store-for-trusted-services

commit_message:
Add keystone v3 support to glance

This introduces 2 new config options: admin_user_id and admin_project_id
to specify the glance service admin user. These are used when authenticating
with keystone v3

Change-Id: I5f4c5411ed3fc88b912dee559734ed6e775a2cd2

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-05-25 15:38:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/common/test_ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'SQL and LDAP fixes for get_roles_for_user_and_project user=group ID

When there was a role assigned to a group with the same ID as a user,
the SQL and LDAP assignment backends would incorrectly return the
assignment to the group when requesting roles for the user via the
get_roles_for_user_and_project method.

With this change, assignments to a group with the same ID are not
returned for the user when calling get_roles_for_user_and_project.

Functions were added to compare DNs more accurately based on the
LDAP RFCs.

The fakeldap code was changed to normalize the values when
comparing values for checking if the values match the filter.

Co-Authored By: Nathan Kinder <nkinder@redhat.com>
Co-Authored By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id3d6f66c995e65e37d909359420d71ecdde86b69
Closes-Bug: #1309228
'}]
commit_message:
SQL and LDAP fixes for get_roles_for_user_and_project user=group ID

When there was a role assigned to a group with the same ID as a user,
the SQL and LDAP assignment backends would incorrectly return the
assignment to the group when requesting roles for the user via the
get_roles_for_user_and_project method.

With this change, assignments to a group with the same ID are not
returned for the user when calling get_roles_for_user_and_project.

Functions were added to compare DNs more accurately based on the
LDAP RFCs.

The fakeldap code was changed to normalize the values when
comparing values for checking if the values match the filter.

Co-Authored By: Nathan Kinder <nkinder@redhat.com>
Co-Authored By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id3d6f66c995e65e37d909359420d71ecdde86b69
Closes-Bug: #1309228

commit_message:

heat resources for assignment floating ip

* for nova-network without autoassignment floating ip

Organize getting multiple packages in way similar to

commit_message:
Paginate packages list using 'next_marker' attribute

Organize getting multiple packages in way similar to
pytnon-glanceclient (see http://tinyurl.com/qxqub5w) so it supports
paginating complex query results.

This commit requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/93900/ to work.

Change-Id: I2477999d03e18d055b3308ec3d03d2782d20bdd3
Implements: blueprint app-catalog-pagination

commit_message:
Remove quota_class operations for Nova

According to the serial patches in
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:noquotaclass,n,z, quota_class is
not used anymore, which should be mentioned in the operation guide.

backport: none
Closes-Bug: #1322856

commit_message:
Adds O'Reilly content with edits since May 5th 2014

- Also includes these changes:
  GlusterFS supports Block Storage
  Fix options for nova flavor-access-list
  Fixes bug 1316040 - reference a generic SQL database
  "once instance" -> "one instance"
  recover sheepdog doc

Change-Id: I81f57c189bb5138c89f0208404f31c4453ec0aac

Removed unused global var and unnessary param

We don't change CONF args and don't need to neither store them nor
pass to CONF.

commit_message:
Fix parameters in VMware glance configuration

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/96442/

A number of parameters in the VMware glance configuration commands were
missing the preceding dashes. This prevented the commands from running
successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1322269

commit_message:
Fix parameters in VMware glance configuration

A number of parameters in the VMware glance configuration commands were
missing the preceding dashes. This prevented the commands from running
successfully.

Closes-Bug: #1322269
Change-Id: I226423f89e9d3bd515440acdd9a1e4f3d8c0941c
backport: icehouse

commit_message:
Refactor api.catalog.search() method to provide 'next_marker' value

That way it works like Glance (see http://tinyurl.com/jwqtj23) and
allows for complex query pagination (to cycle through pages filtered
by some criteria, muranoclient uses 'next_marker' pointer).

Implements: blueprint app-catalog-pagination
Change-Id: If71da70fa835a1ee7a271ebf7238c0a4c64d4123

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-27 10:17:03.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/openstack/common/gettextutils.py', 'sahara/openstack/common/jsonutils.py', 'openstack-common.conf', 'sahara/openstack/common/strutils.py'], 'message': "Synced jsonutils from oslo-incubator

The sync includes change that makes sure we get unicode-only dicts from
jsonutils no matter which json module implementation is selected.

The latest commit in oslo-incubator:
- 0f4586c0076183c6356eec682c8a593648125abd

The sync adds a new 'strutils' module that is now used in jsonutils.

Change-Id: Ic815ca3df94c33edec9104172048b2cd94b92e3f
Closes-Bug: 1314129
"}]
commit_message:
Synced jsonutils from oslo-incubator

The sync includes change that makes sure we get unicode-only dicts from
jsonutils no matter which json module implementation is selected.

The latest commit in oslo-incubator:
- 0f4586c0076183c6356eec682c8a593648125abd

The sync adds a new 'strutils' module that is now used in jsonutils.

Change-Id: Ic815ca3df94c33edec9104172048b2cd94b92e3f
Closes-Bug: 1314129

'}]
commit_message:
Add import_exceptions to tox.ini

In oslo-incubator Oslo incubator multiple functions can be imported
from gettextutils on one line. So we should allow such imports in
hacking.

Change-Id: Ic55996987d312839c5e6863a1eb99faea3b575a9

commit_message:
Ensure metadata is saved before updating volume status

This patch ensures the volume metadata is saved to
the snapshot metadata before updating the status
of the snapshot to be available.

Change-Id: Iada010520dc3c086fcd410a6c7fd152cf4a31561
Closes-Bug: #1310991

the RPC API. This is a first step towards being able to enable rolling
upgrades for Ironic.

In Debian, debconf takes care of selecting the correct plug-in, and
there is no specific plug-in packages (they are all contained within
python-neutron and neutron-common). This patch fixes the procedure
for Debian, and also displays the screenshot which was removed
somehow.

Closes-bug: #1319026
Backport: icehouse

commit_message:
Fix neutron ml2 procedure

In Debian, debconf takes care of selecting the correct plug-in, and
there is no specific plug-in packages (they are all contained within
python-neutron and neutron-common). This patch fixes the procedure
for Debian, and also displays the screenshot which was removed
somehow.

Change-Id: Icc1ff8090dc03014401bbccd5fcb1abbb8b7084d
Closes-bug: #1319026
Backport: icehouse

The sync includes change that drastically enhances performance on Python
2.6 with fresh simplejson library installed.

The latest commit in oslo-incubator:

The following changes are included with this patch:
* jsonutils.py:
--> a6b2aec On Python <= 2.6, use simplejson if available
--> 18f2bc1 Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()

* gettextutils.py:
--> no commits, fixed incorrect sync from the last time

* strutils.py:
--> 8a0f567 Remove str() from LOG.* and exceptions

Change-Id: Ib3dc0b713ed90396919feba018772243b3b9c90f
Closes-Bug: 1314129
'}]
commit_message:
Synced jsonutils from oslo-incubator

The sync includes change that drastically enhances performance on Python
2.6 with fresh simplejson library installed.

The latest commit in oslo-incubator:
- 0f4586c0076183c6356eec682c8a593648125abd

The following changes are included with this patch:
* jsonutils.py:
--> a6b2aec On Python <= 2.6, use simplejson if available
--> 18f2bc1 Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()

* gettextutils.py:
--> no commits, fixed incorrect sync from the last time

* strutils.py:
--> 8a0f567 Remove str() from LOG.* and exceptions

Change-Id: Ib3dc0b713ed90396919feba018772243b3b9c90f
Closes-Bug: 1314129

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 518, 'name': 'Soren Hansen', 'email': 'soren@linux2go.dk', 'username': 'soren'}, {'_account_id': 612, 'name': 'Tom Fifield', 'email': 'tom@openstack.org', 'username': 'fifieldt'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 18:55:38.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': "always log a traceback in the sys.excepthook

oslo logging overwrites the system sys.excepthook. However, in
the default case it does so in a way that masks the actual exception.
This means that developing with oslo logging enabled is really
really frustrating, as python syntax errors are just randomly
swallowed and you are off to guessing.

Because it's taking over the system level excepthook, it needs to
not do the very unexpected thing and eat all the real information.

Change-Id: I8d03d4abd77453856191c48512b7a27a7773084b
"}]
commit_message:
always log a traceback in the sys.excepthook

oslo logging overwrites the system sys.excepthook. However, in
the default case it does so in a way that masks the actual exception.
This means that developing with oslo logging enabled is really
really frustrating, as python syntax errors are just randomly
swallowed and you are off to guessing.

Because it's taking over the system level excepthook, it needs to
not do the very unexpected thing and eat all the real information.

Change-Id: I8d03d4abd77453856191c48512b7a27a7773084b

where not properly enforced. Fix the fallout:

If 2 calendar widgets are opened, widget "To:" is always on the

As result I can't fully choose "From:" date if "To:" widget is

Closes-bug:#1307541

commit_message:
Inactive calendar widget should be closed

If 2 calendar widgets are opened, widget "To:" is always on the
top of widget "From:" despite of what of text field is active.
As result I can't fully choose "From:" date if "To:" widget is
also opened.

Change-Id: I72878120cff1db2aa42a7f6843e61d9252e3106b
Closes-bug:#1307541

commit_message:
Removed redundant dependency of hp3parclient

This dependency, at first, is unused,
and at second - was removed from
openstack requirements:
https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/01ceffe54f9e46c5ee04048c7a1db66960e28eb7
It breaks devstack installation on ci jobs.

Change-Id: I09a3ac8c7f64c6baef74454d98b03daf613cade9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-02 20:38:23.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/util/event_simulator.py', 'trove/tests/api/instances.py'], 'message': 'Fail a test if time.sleep called for no reason

If a mild error screws something up in task manager, an entire class
of tests will continue polling using GET requests until they hit their
rate limit, destroying any attempt to parse the test output to see
what is wrong. This pull request fixes that.

Change-Id: I7c00a174dfb7970357ee2bd71550983d68e0e8ae
Closes-Bug: 1315518
'}]
commit_message:
Fail a test if time.sleep called for no reason

If a mild error screws something up in task manager, an entire class
of tests will continue polling using GET requests until they hit their
rate limit, destroying any attempt to parse the test output to see
what is wrong. This pull request fixes that.

Change-Id: I7c00a174dfb7970357ee2bd71550983d68e0e8ae
Closes-Bug: 1315518

commit_message:
Rework localized tox scripts

Use tools/test-languages.sh as common script for all three tox jobs and
parametrize it accordingly.

subject: VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when instance is deleted
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7473, 'name': 'Grant Murphy', 'email': 'grantcmurphy@gmail.com', 'username': 'gm'}, {'_account_id': 11236, 'name': 'Nanuk Krinner', 'email': 'nkrinner@suse.de', 'username': 'nkrinner'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 08:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py'], 'message': 'VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when instance is deleted

If the user creates a rescue instance and then proceeded to delete
the original instance then the rescue instance would still be up
and running on the backend.

This patch ensures that the rescue instance is cleaned up if
necessary.

The vmops unrescue method has a new parameter indicating if
the original VM should be powered on.

Closes-bug: 1269418
(cherry picked from commit efb66531bc37ee416778a70d46c657608ca767af)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I3c1d0b1d003392b306094b80ea1ac99377441fbf
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when instance is deleted

If the user creates a rescue instance and then proceeded to delete
the original instance then the rescue instance would still be up
and running on the backend.

This patch ensures that the rescue instance is cleaned up if
necessary.

The vmops unrescue method has a new parameter indicating if
the original VM should be powered on.

Closes-bug: 1269418
(cherry picked from commit efb66531bc37ee416778a70d46c657608ca767af)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I3c1d0b1d003392b306094b80ea1ac99377441fbf

commit_message:
VMWare: add power off vm before detach disk during unrescue

Non Hot Plug type disk like IDE can only be detached when the VM is power off.

Close-bug: #1279199
(cherry picked from commit 1e1915aaaca38b5691794e0e052a42b9d95dd3c2)

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ib1f387a41abe2b52357854e90c2535ebb7b43f18

subject: Added variable cert_file from ssl utils to validate CA_file.pem of nova and cinder
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-15 14:09:51.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/remote.py'], 'message': 'Added variable cert_file from ssl utils to validate CA_file.pem of nova and cinder

Trove, to work with keystone and cinder that accept HTTPS connections
need to validate the CA_file.pem. Inorder to validate that,
Added a new parameter ca_cert in cfg.py and added tha same to be
passed as argument to client() of keystone and cinder in remote.py

Updated changes as per comments.Using the existing sslutils

Closes-bug: #1293826

Change-Id: I9aee453e57a31e76509ed6893e64b2a2187ef571
'}]
commit_message:
Added variable cert_file from ssl utils to validate CA_file.pem of nova and cinder

Trove, to work with keystone and cinder that accept HTTPS connections
need to validate the CA_file.pem. Inorder to validate that,
Added a new parameter ca_cert in cfg.py and added tha same to be
passed as argument to client() of keystone and cinder in remote.py

Updated changes as per comments.Using the existing sslutils

Closes-bug: #1293826

Change-Id: I9aee453e57a31e76509ed6893e64b2a2187ef571

subject: Remove unnecessary if statement in ceph::mon
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2064, 'name': 'Loic Dachary', 'email': 'loic@dachary.org', 'username': 'dachary'}, {'_account_id': 9061, 'name': 'David Moreau Simard', 'email': 'moi@dmsimard.com', 'username': 'dmsimard'}, {'_account_id': 9133, 'name': 'Puppet Ceph CI', 'username': 'puppetceph', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11479, 'name': 'David Gurtner', 'email': 'aldavud@crimson.ch', 'username': 'aldavud'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-28 23:16:16.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/ceph_mons_spec.rb', 'manifests/mon.pp', 'spec/defines/ceph_mon_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary if statement in ceph::mon

A previous patchset implementing RedHat family support for ceph::mon had
an erroneous if statement in the OS selection code.
This is fixed here, in its own patchset though, as changes to the previous
patchset failed the CI tests (and even crashed the test infrastructure as
it got stuck indefinitely.)

The removal of the if statement requires some changes in the tests as well.

Also added a check for the exec in RedHat family.

Change-Id: I38fbf189c806a21c40bb55dd47d6debb3a592b89
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary if statement in ceph::mon

A previous patchset implementing RedHat family support for ceph::mon had
an erroneous if statement in the OS selection code.
This is fixed here, in its own patchset though, as changes to the previous
patchset failed the CI tests (and even crashed the test infrastructure as
it got stuck indefinitely.)

The removal of the if statement requires some changes in the tests as well.

Also added a check for the exec in RedHat family.

Change-Id: I38fbf189c806a21c40bb55dd47d6debb3a592b89

And updated the CI tests. ceph::repo needs to be removed whenever
a different release is targeted. This is mainly because "enabled" is
used in yumrepos, because of the lack of "ensure" in Puppet < 3.5
Refactored to not have to switch ceph::repo constantly, but run tests
on a per release order.

Change-Id: I555acda7413765aaa99f922893649e1f13215450
Closes-Bug: #1264916
Closes-Bug: #1323841
Closes-Bug: #1323838
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed removal command in ceph::osd

And updated the CI tests. ceph::repo needs to be removed whenever
a different release is targeted. This is mainly because "enabled" is
used in yumrepos, because of the lack of "ensure" in Puppet < 3.5
Refactored to not have to switch ceph::repo constantly, but run tests
on a per release order.

Change-Id: I555acda7413765aaa99f922893649e1f13215450
Closes-Bug: #1264916
Closes-Bug: #1323841
Closes-Bug: #1323838

Support for RedHat in ceph::mon and in ceph::mon, ceph::keys CI tests.

Yumrepo isn't propperly removed but only disabled. This leads to a need

Change-Id: I51150c1e3316bdab20c4458e79c4aeeb15fe4bd2

Closes-Bug: #1323841
"}]
commit_message:
Support for RedHat in ceph::mon

Support for RedHat in ceph::mon and in ceph::mon, ceph::keys CI tests.

Yumrepo isn't propperly removed but only disabled. This leads to a need
to ensure => absent on the ceph::repo whenever a switch to a different
ceph version happens. Therefore it's refactored run tests ordered by
release

Change-Id: I51150c1e3316bdab20c4458e79c4aeeb15fe4bd2
Closes-Bug: #1264916
Closes-Bug: #1323841

commit_message:
script to generate the sitemap.xml for docs.openstack.org

This script crawls all available sites on http://docs.openstack.org and extracts
all URLs. Based on the URLs the script generates a sitemap for search engines
according to the protocol described at http://www.sitemaps.org/protocol.html.

subject: Change NodeLocked status code to a client-side error
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7882, 'name': 'Yuiko Takada Mori', 'email': 'yuiko-mori@nec.com', 'username': 'YuikoTakada'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-28 08:59:53.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/exception.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/client_wrapper.py'], 'message': "Change NodeLocked status code to a client-side error

Currently, the NodeLocked exception's HTTP status code indicates a
server-side failure, resulting in WSME logging it as such, and this
is leading to random failures in our CI tests. While NodeLocked is
a valid issue which should (currently) be exposed to the client,
it is not a server-side error and does not warrant a 5xx status code.

This patch changes the HTTP status code for this exception to
409 CONFLICT, causing WSME to log it as a warning. This is not ideal,
but it resolves the immediate issue (random CI test failures).

A longer term solution is being drafted at:
https://review.openstack.org/94923

Change-Id: Ied9dcf9bbcb505177adc57d7d8fe06e4096ff488
Closes-Bug: #1321494
"}]
commit_message:
Change NodeLocked status code to a client-side error

Currently, the NodeLocked exception's HTTP status code indicates a
server-side failure, resulting in WSME logging it as such, and this
is leading to random failures in our CI tests. While NodeLocked is
a valid issue which should (currently) be exposed to the client,
it is not a server-side error and does not warrant a 5xx status code.

This patch changes the HTTP status code for this exception to
409 CONFLICT, causing WSME to log it as a warning. This is not ideal,
but it resolves the immediate issue (random CI test failures).

A longer term solution is being drafted at:
https://review.openstack.org/94923

Change-Id: Ied9dcf9bbcb505177adc57d7d8fe06e4096ff488
Closes-Bug: #1321494

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-23 15:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Restore ability to run functional tests with run_tests.sh

Change f20b1d42 which split the running of functional tests from
the running of unit tests caused running:
  ./run_tests.sh neutron.tests.functional
to fail as the OS_TEST_PATH variable will be defaulted to
neutron.tests.unit which means that the functional tests will not
be discovered in the above case.

This patch trys to detect an argument passed in the form of a
neutron.tests string and correctly sets the OS_TEST_PATH variable
based on it.

Change-Id: I8ccdc7f10d3c8478281aeaf8d02175d0eeb8d6e9
'}]
commit_message:
Restore ability to run functional tests with run_tests.sh

Change f20b1d42 which split the running of functional tests from
the running of unit tests caused running:
  ./run_tests.sh neutron.tests.functional
to fail as the OS_TEST_PATH variable will be defaulted to
neutron.tests.unit which means that the functional tests will not
be discovered in the above case.

This patch trys to detect an argument passed in the form of a
neutron.tests string and correctly sets the OS_TEST_PATH variable
based on it.

Change-Id: I8ccdc7f10d3c8478281aeaf8d02175d0eeb8d6e9

subject: Make FakeRing use more real code
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-16 18:57:07.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/unit/__init__.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py'], 'message': "Make FakeRing use more real code

The existing FakeRing mock's implementation bit me on some pretty
subtle character encoding issue by-passing the hash_path code that is
normally part of get_part_nodes.  This change tries to exercise more
of the real ring code paths when it makes sense and provide a better
Fake for use in testing.

Change-Id: I87e10b78ed0963344988f73e946ecda7a96cc6a8
"}]
commit_message:
Make FakeRing use more real code

The existing FakeRing mock's implementation bit me on some pretty
subtle character encoding issue by-passing the hash_path code that is
normally part of get_part_nodes.  This change tries to exercise more
of the real ring code paths when it makes sense and provide a better
Fake for use in testing.

Change-Id: I87e10b78ed0963344988f73e946ecda7a96cc6a8

commit_message:
tests/unit: Initialize core plugin in TestL3GwModeMixin

TestL3GwModeMixin can fail randomly because it doesn't initialize
core_plugin and can be run random core plugin depending on execution
order of tests. It also fails with core plugin uninitialized when it
is run without other tests.

This patch refactors the setup code of core plugin and apply it to the
related tests.
This patch reveled the same bug of test_metaplugin.py which is also
fixed by this patch.

Closes-bug: #1273259

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/base.py
	neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_ext_gw_mode.py

Change-Id: I3c1d4d8b3d69262b89c7747daa8267bf2c8e7f6b
(cherry picked from commit 9e247277e2d916fa705715e018ef5f3f221f0efa)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-05-28 14:17:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/periodic_task.py'], 'message': "Sync periodic_task from oslo-incubator

We have not updated periodic_task in over six months and we should have
commit 47c9d60657be4ad58afa3c7e3ef88885a595c4c3 in nova.

Note that this does not include the gettextutils and log dependencies
since there are not functional changes in those modules needed for the
periodic_task changes synced in *and* more importantly, the changes
to gettextutils and log require pervasive changes to nova which should
happen when nova integrates with the oslo-i18n library for
blueprint i18n--messages.

Further note that this does not include jsonutils due to some
issues introduced with a change for python 2.6 that impacts some of
the unit tests in Nova and how strings are encoded with simplejson.
The details for that issue are in bug 1314129.  The jsonutils changes
are not related to the periodic_task changes being synced in so the
dependency is not functionally required.

periodic_task:
c63fd5a Make unspecified periodic spaced tasks run on default interval
f0dd798 Remove rendundant parentheses of cfg help strings
fcf517d Update oslo log messages with translation domains
051b9f3 Refactor unnecessary arithmetic ops in periodic_task
674cdaf Refactor if logic in periodic_task
b6b82c5 Use timestamp in periodic tasks
47c9d60 Don't share periodic_task instance data in a class attr
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
c5a1088 Typos fix in db and periodic_task module
12bcdb7 Remove vim header

Related-Bug: #1319232

Change-Id: I5534e85ae8791c7c464357f7fd57b986ff74d092
"}]
commit_message:
Sync periodic_task from oslo-incubator

We have not updated periodic_task in over six months and we should have
commit 47c9d60657be4ad58afa3c7e3ef88885a595c4c3 in nova.

Note that this does not include the gettextutils and log dependencies
since there are not functional changes in those modules needed for the
periodic_task changes synced in *and* more importantly, the changes
to gettextutils and log require pervasive changes to nova which should
happen when nova integrates with the oslo-i18n library for
blueprint i18n--messages.

Further note that this does not include jsonutils due to some
issues introduced with a change for python 2.6 that impacts some of
the unit tests in Nova and how strings are encoded with simplejson.
The details for that issue are in bug 1314129.  The jsonutils changes
are not related to the periodic_task changes being synced in so the
dependency is not functionally required.

periodic_task:
c63fd5a Make unspecified periodic spaced tasks run on default interval
f0dd798 Remove rendundant parentheses of cfg help strings
fcf517d Update oslo log messages with translation domains
051b9f3 Refactor unnecessary arithmetic ops in periodic_task
674cdaf Refactor if logic in periodic_task
b6b82c5 Use timestamp in periodic tasks
47c9d60 Don't share periodic_task instance data in a class attr
8b2b0b7 Use hacking import_exceptions for gettextutils._
c5a1088 Typos fix in db and periodic_task module
12bcdb7 Remove vim header

Related-Bug: #1319232

Change-Id: I5534e85ae8791c7c464357f7fd57b986ff74d092

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-05-28 03:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/volume/v2/xml/volumes_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/xml/volumes_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/json/volumes_client.py', 'tempest/services/volume/v2/json/volumes_client.py', 'tempest/api/volume/base.py'], 'message': "Sharing codes for cinder v1 and v2 tests

Tempest doesn't have enough Cinder v2 api tests. We need to add more
tests for it. Cinder v2 api only has some small updates, so v1 and v2
tests could share service client and test code.
This patch makes the follwoing initial chanages to support sharing
codes between v1 and v2:

1. Rename volumes v1 client to a base client, then create v1 and v2
   clients inheriting base client.
2. Create common base test class instead of
   BaseVolumeV1Test/BaseVolumeV2Test. They will be remove after all
   test classes using sharing codes.

Partially implements: blueprint cinder-v2-api-tests

Change-Id: I52c10a405660e134dcc8d61bcb99f68852013765
"}]
commit_message:
Sharing codes for cinder v1 and v2 tests

Tempest doesn't have enough Cinder v2 api tests. We need to add more
tests for it. Cinder v2 api only has some small updates, so v1 and v2
tests could share service client and test code.
This patch makes the follwoing initial chanages to support sharing
codes between v1 and v2:

1. Rename volumes v1 client to a base client, then create v1 and v2
   clients inheriting base client.
2. Create common base test class instead of
   BaseVolumeV1Test/BaseVolumeV2Test. They will be remove after all
   test classes using sharing codes.

Partially implements: blueprint cinder-v2-api-tests

Change-Id: I52c10a405660e134dcc8d61bcb99f68852013765

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-19 06:07:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ibm/sdnve_api.py'], 'message': "Fix the colon mark in the msg key sent to SDN-VE controller

SDN-VE controller does not process the colon mark in the msg key.
Change the colon mark to underline, which the SDN-VE controller
will handle the external network creation. E.g.,
'router:external:true' will be change to 'router_external:true'.

Change-Id: I9f436a78dbbc81c1a57b7f862078352b4ef6f6d6
Fixes: bug #1320086
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the colon mark in the msg key sent to SDN-VE controller

SDN-VE controller does not process the colon mark in the msg key.
Change the colon mark to underline, which the SDN-VE controller
will handle the external network creation. E.g.,
'router:external:true' will be change to 'router_external:true'.

Change-Id: I9f436a78dbbc81c1a57b7f862078352b4ef6f6d6
Fixes: bug #1320086

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-29 01:03:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/firewall/fwaas_plugin.py'], 'message': "FWaaS plugin doesn't need to handle firewall rule del ops

If firewall rule is attached to firewall policy, it would raise
FirewallRuleInUse excpetion in DB ops, else it is a pure DB delete ops.
So it is useless to handle delete_firewall_rule ops in fwaas plugin.
Closes-Bug: #1322076

Change-Id: I55a000d206f232c79b41230f526007f684db8f4f
"}]
commit_message:
FWaaS plugin doesn't need to handle firewall rule del ops

If firewall rule is attached to firewall policy, it would raise
FirewallRuleInUse excpetion in DB ops, else it is a pure DB delete ops.
So it is useless to handle delete_firewall_rule ops in fwaas plugin.
Closes-Bug: #1322076

Change-Id: I55a000d206f232c79b41230f526007f684db8f4f

To allow for failures to be handled in different

Change-Id: Ief422bb57316b913897ca65496144edcfdd1a948
'}]
commit_message:
Factor out the on_failure to a mixin type

To allow for failures to be handled in different
ways extract out the on_failure definition of a
retry object to allow it to be its own mixin or
base class for resolvers that can only provide a
on_failure method.

Change-Id: Ief422bb57316b913897ca65496144edcfdd1a948

commit_message:
Clamp pm_password to 255 for nova-bm nodes

Due to nova If26b648dee95abc5aa0bf80d3111265b00141b6d, pm_password
is now enforced to be 255 characters, so clamp pm_password to 255
characters before creating the node.

Change-Id: Id5c489eb7d6ef555c588207e7f5ba34a55d33000
Closes-Bug: #1322599

subject: Create and use a new compilation module
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-05-22 02:27:53.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/compiler.py'], 'message': 'Create and use a new compilation module

To allow compilation into an execution graph to be done via
other methods than our pattern flattening concept create a module
that defines what a compiler should do and what the expected return
type from compilation of a atom/flow is and how it will be used by
our existing engine types.

Part of blueprint plug-engine

Change-Id: I324172571f36a574195bcdeac71c6ec14cb11944
'}]
commit_message:
Create and use a new compilation module

To allow compilation into an execution graph to be done via
other methods than our pattern flattening concept create a module
that defines what a compiler should do and what the expected return
type from compilation of a atom/flow is and how it will be used by
our existing engine types.

Part of blueprint plug-engine

Change-Id: I324172571f36a574195bcdeac71c6ec14cb11944

subject: Source lib/apache before lib/keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-28 19:52:03.000000000', 'files': ['upgrade-cinder', 'upgrade-nova', 'upgrade-tempest', 'upgrade-glance', 'upgrade-neutron', 'stop-base'], 'message': "Source lib/apache before lib/keystone

DevStack's lib/keystone depends on lib/apache. When lib/keystone
depends on any change introduced in lib/apache the build is broken as
lib/apache was not being sourced before that.

This change sources lib/apache just before sourcing lib/tls, as is
done in devstack/stack.sh.

Change-Id: Id0f51c678d4f16aaece08a4e5a74c48cc2ab1e6c
"}]
commit_message:
Source lib/apache before lib/keystone

DevStack's lib/keystone depends on lib/apache. When lib/keystone
depends on any change introduced in lib/apache the build is broken as
lib/apache was not being sourced before that.

This change sources lib/apache just before sourcing lib/tls, as is
done in devstack/stack.sh.

Change-Id: Id0f51c678d4f16aaece08a4e5a74c48cc2ab1e6c

commit_message:
remove cpu feature duplications in libvirt

This patch fixes a bug in libvirt driver get_host_capabilities where
some features can be duplicated. In this patch we use the features returned
from baselineCPU as the only set of features.

Change-Id: Ib708e31e5ae14e93b384d2a8933079ca83ca8aaf
Closes-Bug: #1322702

commit_message:
Sync with oslo-incubator caed79d

This syncs python-keystoneclient with oslo-incubator commit hash
caed79d8239679cb74476bb0d9e5011b4fcc39da

First, remove the existing code to cleanup:
 $ rm -r keystoneclient/openstack/*

Then, sync from oslo-incubator:
 $ python update.py ../python-keystoneclient

Commits since last sync (2640847):
----------------------------------
1173e46 Remove ValueError when accessing sys.modules
90ae24b Remove redundant default=None for config options
18f2bc1 Enforce unicode json output for jsonutils.load[s]()
4a777e5 Fix warnings in doc build for apiclient

Related-Bug: #1315523
Closes-Bug: #1314129
Change-Id: Id53ea2d4828e81bc6270f186849f391e7bc73101

subject: Allow any attributes in mapping and include in results
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-01 00:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'message': 'Allow any attributes in mapping and include in results

When using attribute mapping (e.g., user_additional_attribute_mapping), any
attributes that Keystone didn't know about were ignored and a warning was
issued, like

 WARNING keystone.common.ldap.core [-] Invalid additional attribute mapping:
 "description:description". Value "description" must use one of password,
 enabled, default_project_id, name, email.

This check is removed. Additional attribute mappings for "unexpected"
attributes (such as description) should be allowed. For one thing, all the
known attributes already have a way of setting the mapping, via the
user_*_attribute config option. This will allow setting a "description" or
any other attribute mapping for users.

The extra attributes defined in the *_additional_attribute_mapping config
options weren't included in the list results. These attributes should be
included in the list results.

This is a combination of 3 commits from master:
(cherry picked from commit 17db03164200f0d7fff564058fc7df8e97705523)
(cherry picked from commit 10051adace7cd728d46cd4c999e3019fdbf2d961)
(cherry picked from commit ebfdab034f2b35074f1645b70c1f07d0c4dfd337)

Change-Id: Ia80174063a5eacdef690ca378b7cb71300a5f5f8
Closes-Bug: #1293698
'}]
commit_message:
Allow any attributes in mapping and include in results

When using attribute mapping (e.g., user_additional_attribute_mapping), any
attributes that Keystone didn't know about were ignored and a warning was
issued, like

 WARNING keystone.common.ldap.core [-] Invalid additional attribute mapping:
 "description:description". Value "description" must use one of password,
 enabled, default_project_id, name, email.

This check is removed. Additional attribute mappings for "unexpected"
attributes (such as description) should be allowed. For one thing, all the
known attributes already have a way of setting the mapping, via the
user_*_attribute config option. This will allow setting a "description" or
any other attribute mapping for users.

The extra attributes defined in the *_additional_attribute_mapping config
options weren't included in the list results. These attributes should be
included in the list results.

This is a combination of 3 commits from master:
(cherry picked from commit 17db03164200f0d7fff564058fc7df8e97705523)
(cherry picked from commit 10051adace7cd728d46cd4c999e3019fdbf2d961)
(cherry picked from commit ebfdab034f2b35074f1645b70c1f07d0c4dfd337)

Change-Id: Ia80174063a5eacdef690ca378b7cb71300a5f5f8
Closes-Bug: #1293698

Getting cluster_info, after we created transient cluster and run a job
on it, might fail if cluster was terminated by periodic before that.
On the other hand, we only need cluster_id from the cluster_info, which
we already have. For example see the following test run:

https://sahara.mirantis.com/logs/22/93322/1/check/gate-sahara-integration-transient/e03a813/console.html

Change-Id: I1efa4da87ebcbfbcd5d04f9b8eaf3b218562b8d1

commit_message:
Fix intermittent transient cluster tests failure

Getting cluster_info, after we created transient cluster and run a job
on it, might fail if cluster was terminated by periodic before that.
On the other hand, we only need cluster_id from the cluster_info, which
we already have. For example see the following test run:

https://sahara.mirantis.com/logs/22/93322/1/check/gate-sahara-integration-transient/e03a813/console.html

Change-Id: I1efa4da87ebcbfbcd5d04f9b8eaf3b218562b8d1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-23 05:34:19.000000000', 'files': ['stop-base'], 'message': "Don't reset IFS when calling screen_stop

Looking through logs I saw a whole bunch of

  2014-05-23 01:36:30.263 | /opt/stack/old/devstack/functions-common:
    line 1442: set -o xtrace: command not found

which was very strange, until I noticed grenade is changing IFS when
it calls screen_stop, so when that calls ${xtrace} the spaces aren't
split-up.

Change-Id: I20eb7d86839ea813a662e35b7d281382c085baa9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't reset IFS when calling screen_stop

Looking through logs I saw a whole bunch of

  2014-05-23 01:36:30.263 | /opt/stack/old/devstack/functions-common:
    line 1442: set -o xtrace: command not found

which was very strange, until I noticed grenade is changing IFS when
it calls screen_stop, so when that calls ${xtrace} the spaces aren't
split-up.

Change-Id: I20eb7d86839ea813a662e35b7d281382c085baa9

commit_message:
Fixes probe tests with non-zero default storage policy

Add headers param to direct_client.direct_get_object, which is used in
probetests to passthrough the X-Storage-Policy-Index header.

Raise SkipTest if default policy type is not replication

Change-Id: I19adbbcefbc086c8467bd904a275d55cde596412

subject: Allow NotFound to be created without args
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 9542, 'name': 'Pavlo Shchelokovskyy', 'email': 'pshchelokovskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pshchelo'}, {'_account_id': 10090, 'name': 'Amit Ugol', 'email': 'augol@redhat.com', 'username': 'cmyster'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 21:33:15.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/tests/test_api_openstack_v1.py'], 'message': 'Allow NotFound to be created without args

It appears that the serialization used to wrap RPC exceptions
requires that the class be instantiated without any arguments.

Since the NotFound exception required a msg_fmt it could not be
deserialized in heat-api, which lead to no mapping in the FaultWrapper
so a 500 was raised instead of a 404.

This change adds a default value for msg_fmt for the NotFound exception.

The classes Error and ResourceFailure likely have this issue too, but it
is not as serious since they will raise a 500 error anyway.

Config/deployment API tests now check that NotFound can be deserialized by
calling to_remote_error, and checks that FaultWrapper converts that to
HTTPNotFound.

Change-Id: Ieb8de26465cb26aa015f15c134f80a06ebcae95c
Closes-Bug: #1301657
Related-Bug: #1304743
'}]
commit_message:
Allow NotFound to be created without args

It appears that the serialization used to wrap RPC exceptions
requires that the class be instantiated without any arguments.

Since the NotFound exception required a msg_fmt it could not be
deserialized in heat-api, which lead to no mapping in the FaultWrapper
so a 500 was raised instead of a 404.

This change adds a default value for msg_fmt for the NotFound exception.

The classes Error and ResourceFailure likely have this issue too, but it
is not as serious since they will raise a 500 error anyway.

Config/deployment API tests now check that NotFound can be deserialized by
calling to_remote_error, and checks that FaultWrapper converts that to
HTTPNotFound.

Change-Id: Ieb8de26465cb26aa015f15c134f80a06ebcae95c
Closes-Bug: #1301657
Related-Bug: #1304743

subject: Don't begin heartbeating until the API server is listening
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-20 21:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/agent.py'], 'message': "Don't begin heartbeating until the API server is listening

As soon as the agent sends its first heartbeat, it may begin receiving
API calls. As such, we should wait until the server is actually
listening before starting the heartbeater.

Change-Id: Id2984f3f0f50cdb725b10913d38b990f99c48b0a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't begin heartbeating until the API server is listening

As soon as the agent sends its first heartbeat, it may begin receiving
API calls. As such, we should wait until the server is actually
listening before starting the heartbeater.

Change-Id: Id2984f3f0f50cdb725b10913d38b990f99c48b0a

commit_message:
Support 'infinite' dhcp_lease_duration

Process a dhcp_lease_duration value of -1 as 'infinite'
when setting the dnsmasq dhcp-range values to support
cases where it is undesirable for instance dhcp leases
to expire.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1315430
Change-Id: I1cc3cfebfec355014e6d5b5cbd656a1300c43c0b

commit_message:
Add -x and console output for dhcp-all-interfaces

We experience 10%ish failure rates when booting trusty baremetal nodes.
It appears to halt the system during the dhcp-all-interfaces script.
Adding additional debug output for this script.

Change-Id: If20f4b4d27db699f26521de141afc8e11ac3ea68

commit_message:
add the ability to inject arguments into tasks at task creation

Similar to the rebind functionality that lets you rename parameters
from those in the store, inject lets you inject arbitrary key/value
pairs that will be sent to your task at task creation time.  This allows
for flow and flow factories to reuse tasks with differing parameters
without jumping through a lot of hoops.

Change-Id: If167962811d22054b89d7d35a33d4ec5cb2cd648
Implements: blueprint wbe-workers-endpoints-constructors

subject: Moved the registration of lifecycle event handler in init_host()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-22 17:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Moved the registration of lifecycle event handler in init_host()

The event handler has to be registered before the libvirt connection
is used for the first time.  Otherwise it doesn't register and events
such as shut down initiated from within the instance are not registered
in nova until a period task compares the content of hypervisor with
content of database.

Closes bug: #1297485

Change-Id: I70887bea343734a977f621fedc634b6fab0e4ad5
(cherry picked from commit 8a430da045d86ccb8daee6e082c12890ce5c5276)
"}]
commit_message:
Moved the registration of lifecycle event handler in init_host()

The event handler has to be registered before the libvirt connection
is used for the first time.  Otherwise it doesn't register and events
such as shut down initiated from within the instance are not registered
in nova until a period task compares the content of hypervisor with
content of database.

Closes bug: #1297485

Change-Id: I70887bea343734a977f621fedc634b6fab0e4ad5
(cherry picked from commit 8a430da045d86ccb8daee6e082c12890ce5c5276)

subject: Change errors_out_migration decorator to work with RPC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-22 17:37:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Change errors_out_migration decorator to work with RPC

This decorator in nova/compute/manager.py was written to work with
positional arguments, but at run time the decorated methods are
called via RPC with keyword arguments.  This change fixes the
decorator and the associated test cases.

Closes-Bug: #1300380

Change-Id: I9f87151a71e5217e7eff97cdc5cad2c85b620fa5
(cherry picked from commit 72cd430e971589f7872a9d4e8f173c68b4955375)
'}]
commit_message:
Change errors_out_migration decorator to work with RPC

This decorator in nova/compute/manager.py was written to work with
positional arguments, but at run time the decorated methods are
called via RPC with keyword arguments.  This change fixes the
decorator and the associated test cases.

Closes-Bug: #1300380

Change-Id: I9f87151a71e5217e7eff97cdc5cad2c85b620fa5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 21:19:45.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'chown stack/data/nova/networks to $STACK_USER

$USER may be undefined (resulting in an error exit from stack.sh)
or may be the current $USER rather than the target $STACK_USER
(which may or may not be the same) which could lead to errors
later.

This change brings about consistency: the rest of stack.sh always

commit_message:
chown stack/data/nova/networks to $STACK_USER

$USER may be undefined (resulting in an error exit from stack.sh)
or may be the current $USER rather than the target $STACK_USER
(which may or may not be the same) which could lead to errors
later.

This change brings about consistency: the rest of stack.sh always
uses $STACK_USER.

This same problem may be present in lib/marconi.

Change-Id: Idff2bee88de4e1da11cd5765a03646caf3ede24f

subject: Ironic "lock already held" when powering off nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-28 15:12:16.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/register-nodes'], 'message': 'Ironic "lock already held" when powering off nodes

When we add a node devtests attempts to power it off the node. During the
time the power off command is run Ironic may be running a
periodic tasks to set the node power which takes an exclusive
lock. Hence making the power off command fail.

This patch will make the script run the ironic power-off 10 time
over 10 seconds to get the command to succeed.

Relate to: bug-1315224

Change-Id: I4d76bab7a3e07f6ff15f4e73440e298cc83eca12
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic "lock already held" when powering off nodes

When we add a node devtests attempts to power it off the node. During the
time the power off command is run Ironic may be running a
periodic tasks to set the node power which takes an exclusive
lock. Hence making the power off command fail.

This patch will make the script run the ironic power-off 10 time
over 10 seconds to get the command to succeed.

Relate to: bug-1315224

Change-Id: I4d76bab7a3e07f6ff15f4e73440e298cc83eca12

commit_message:
drop --cluster from ceph-disk activate (osd).

This commit removes the --cluster option from the 'ceph-disk activate'
part of the osd configuration (when the cluster is given as an arg).
Only 'ceph-disk prepare' accepts a cluster option.

Change-Id: I4027690c36141a184c1fb1b64b382e17cbbcf487
Closes-Bug: #1323120

commit_message:
Remove redundant default=None for config options

By default the cfg modules set the default value as None. There
is no reason to set this.

Change-Id: I58e09e01760b573612c2ee169a8dd1784fd36a82

commit_message:

The final find_resource() call errored because servers.create_image()
returns an image ID rather than an Image resource.  Reset expectations
and arguments.

Reasons:

  it is not called as invalid SERVICE_TYPE.

Changes:

Change-Id: Ia6b1d09d0cb3cf651e08f5c85573e7b32032d9fc
Closes-Bug: #1322612
'}]
commit_message:
Corrects condition to check valid SERVICE_TYPE

Reasons:
- Currently expr is used to match condition, because of which the if
  part of valid SERVICE_TYPE is used, for eg. "mysq" of "mysql", then
  it is not called as invalid SERVICE_TYPE.

Changes:
- Updates the condition to match SERVICE_TYPE in VALID_SERVICES.

Change-Id: Ia6b1d09d0cb3cf651e08f5c85573e7b32032d9fc
Closes-Bug: #1322612

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-06 01:13:21.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/swift_client_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/swift_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/client.pp'], 'message': 'Add client_package_ensure parameter and swift::client class

In the actual state of the manifest we can only setup package_ensure to
absent|present|latest. This commit allow end users to pin swift* and
swift-client to a specific version. (note that swift* and
python-swiftclient version are not the same).

A new class (swift::client) manage now client packages, and we keep the
retro-compatibility of commit 020b7723cbbe75fbcae89514a1e1882ae807fb27.

Change-Id: I9bcc5a0f9d0a93a812fb574c4571fb9584077e4a
'}]
commit_message:
Add client_package_ensure parameter and swift::client class

In the actual state of the manifest we can only setup package_ensure to
absent|present|latest. This commit allow end users to pin swift* and
swift-client to a specific version. (note that swift* and
python-swiftclient version are not the same).

A new class (swift::client) manage now client packages, and we keep the
retro-compatibility of commit 020b7723cbbe75fbcae89514a1e1882ae807fb27.

Change-Id: I9bcc5a0f9d0a93a812fb574c4571fb9584077e4a

There is last patch to migrate on new attribute Schema.
The main changes are:
 - Deprecation warning was added in from_attribute function.
   If attribute have old format, it will be converted to new schema format
   and Deprecation warning will be raised.
 - Translation to new Schema was added in function schema_from_outputs.
 - All generic resources have been changed and use new Schema class now.
 - Some others tests have been fixed and use new Schema class now.

Change-Id: Icf92f2d275a86a13c656b0e74b725a442db3e532
Closes-Bug: #1307319
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecating the old style attribute Schema

There is last patch to migrate on new attribute Schema.
The main changes are:
 - Deprecation warning was added in from_attribute function.
   If attribute have old format, it will be converted to new schema format
   and Deprecation warning will be raised.
 - Translation to new Schema was added in function schema_from_outputs.
 - All generic resources have been changed and use new Schema class now.
 - Some others tests have been fixed and use new Schema class now.

Change-Id: Icf92f2d275a86a13c656b0e74b725a442db3e532
Closes-Bug: #1307319

commit_message:
Miscellaneous doc fixes -- Part 1

index.rst -- fixed "Pre-Installation" string and modified description
  so it doesn't say "you must execute" for the Planning Guide.

pre-install
- 0010-intro -- moved virtualbox piece to end; small edits
- 4000-planning-summary - small edit, deleted "Prepare logical network
  diagram" line since we have no info for that
- 4200-net-topology -- fixed typos
- 4300-linux-distro -- added link to "VLAN splinters" in user-guide
- 4400-nodes-roles
  - added link to "Assigning nodes to roles" in user-guide
  - fixed bad link to virtualbox-top
  - reworded lead in to larger list of nodes
  - augmented note about not running Ceph OSD on controllers with
    a note to not run Ceph OSD and Ceph Mon on same storage node.

ref-arch
- storage/0000-storage-intro had tag with _; changed to -
- logical-setup/0400-storage-nodes linked to the tag in storage/0000-*
  so I fixed that.  Found a couple typos in the file so fixed those
  and added links to Ceph, Cinder, and Swift articles in terminology.

terminology
- bonding -- links to ovs, user guide instructions
- ceilometer -- link to mongodb article
- ceph -- added info about Ceph Mon and Ceph OSD not running on same server
- compute nodes -- link to ref-arch section

user-guide
- 2000-deploy-new -- added info about remote control utility in response
  to Miroslav comment https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95386.
-  "  "  -- added link to vcenter-term on Hypervisor page

Note that the number of PDF build errors has escalated significantly.
This is also the case for Jenkins builds done last night and this morning.
I think it is related to issues with xrefs to titles.  I will continue
to investigate.

Change-Id: Iceecab3fee095b8eb5d1b9139c6faa8faa5f7fad

subject: Fix _delete_assembly in test_trigger_post functional test
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-28 17:08:41.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/test_assembly.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/public/test_trigger.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/test_component.py'], 'message': 'Fix _delete_assembly in test_trigger_post functional test

If assembly is still not deleted after 5 attempts,
we make the test fail instead of assertRaises a TimeoutException.
The assertRaises method was also misused since it should take
at least 3 arguments (2 given).

Change-Id: Id53191e801e1106118d584c7a48af0f59e6c7577
Closes-Bug: #1324135
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _delete_assembly in test_trigger_post functional test

If assembly is still not deleted after 5 attempts,
we make the test fail instead of assertRaises a TimeoutException.
The assertRaises method was also misused since it should take
at least 3 arguments (2 given).

Change-Id: Id53191e801e1106118d584c7a48af0f59e6c7577
Closes-Bug: #1324135

commit_message:
xenapi: refactor volumeops attach

Refactor the attach code, so its more readable.

At the same time, add some new unit tests to better cover the volume
attach code.

In a later patch we will remove the older mox tests, and dead code that
is now only left in volumeops to keep those old tests running.

commit_message:
xenapi: remove calls to call_xenapi in volumeops

As part of the move to remove calls to call_xenapi, this removes calls
in volumeops. This makes the later refactoring and test coverage patches
much easier to write.

Change-Id: I384d7d85382551d32122d475768f015e8dfd8769

commit_message:
Miscellaneous doc fixes -- Part 1

index.rst -- fixed "Pre-Installation" string and modified description
  so it doesn't say "you must execute" for the Planning Guide.

pre-install
- 0010-intro -- moved virtualbox piece to end; small edits
- 4000-planning-summary - small edit, deleted "Prepare logical network
  diagram" line since we have no info for that
- 4200-net-topology -- fixed typos
- 4300-linux-distro -- added link to "VLAN splinters" in user-guide
- 4400-nodes-roles
  - added link to "Assigning nodes to roles" in user-guide
  - fixed bad link to virtualbox-top
  - reworded lead in to larger list of nodes
  - augmented note about not running Ceph OSD on controllers with
    a note to not run Ceph OSD and Ceph Mon on same storage node.

ref-arch
- storage/0000-storage-intro had tag with _; changed to -
- logical-setup/0400-storage-nodes linked to the tag in storage/0000-*
  so I fixed that.  Found a couple typos in the file so fixed those
  and added links to Ceph, Cinder, and Swift articles in terminology.

terminology
- bonding -- links to ovs, user guide instructions
- ceilometer -- link to mongodb article
- ceph -- added info about Ceph Mon and Ceph OSD not running on same server
- compute nodes -- link to ref-arch section

user-guide
- 2000-deploy-new -- added info about remote control utility in response
  to Miroslav comment https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95386.
-  "  "  -- added link to vcenter-term on Hypervisor page

Note that the number of PDF build errors has escalated significantly.
This is also the case for Jenkins builds done last night and this morning.
I think it is related to issues with xrefs to titles.  I will continue
to investigate.

Change-Id: Iceecab3fee095b8eb5d1b9139c6faa8faa5f7fad

commit_message:
Remove ceilometer from default list for master

This is to test why we are failing large-ops-testing (part of
experimental queue). We are seeing cpu idle in single digits with
ceilometer-agent as the top consumer of CPU.

This is for testing only - DO NOT MERGE

should make gate fails a little easier to resolve.

Change-Id: I61a950bf25319945292a36a70b7508839014d59f
"}]
commit_message:
don't corrupt grenade exit value

The grenade exit value was getting masked in the exit handler
by doing something else before we captured it. Fix that, which
should make gate fails a little easier to resolve.

Change-Id: I61a950bf25319945292a36a70b7508839014d59f

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: See what happens when use all of global-requirements

Test to see what if anything will explode if we add an additional gating
test to run on a system with all of global-requirements installed.

This should help address the case where some unit tests are skipped due
to missing optional python libraries. Such as zookeeper

Change-Id: Ic7d66b5aadec2f0101e37c02b79c52d2c86db304

commit_message:
Add TransportKey as a resource

This is the first step in implementing key wrapping from the client.
Transport Keys will be public keys/ certificates which will be
fetched for plugins when storing/retrieving secrets.

Change-Id: I2a71b95f1a3f28bf6671de3ea9dc858218ff4b0d
Implements: blueprint add-wrapping-key-to-barbican-server

subject: OVERRIDE_BRANCH should not apply to ZUUL_PROJECT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-02 18:15:24.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': "OVERRIDE_BRANCH should not apply to ZUUL_PROJECT

* functions.sh(setup_project): If a branch override has been
supplied, don't try to use it to override the name of the zuul ref
for the project on which the particular change is being tested.
Doing otherwise results in attempting to fetch a nonexistent ref
from the zuul merger if that project actually has a branch whose
name matches the override.

Change-Id: I85d8b2f283cfa2649df71d4cb73d49e1657066b8
"}]
commit_message:
OVERRIDE_BRANCH should not apply to ZUUL_PROJECT

* functions.sh(setup_project): If a branch override has been
supplied, don't try to use it to override the name of the zuul ref
for the project on which the particular change is being tested.
Doing otherwise results in attempting to fetch a nonexistent ref
from the zuul merger if that project actually has a branch whose
name matches the override.

Change-Id: I85d8b2f283cfa2649df71d4cb73d49e1657066b8

commit_message:
Change name of SecretMetadatum table to SecretStoreMetadatum

Instead of holding all the metadata attributes for Secrets, this table will
hold only the metadata generated by the SecretStore.  For the SecretStore,
see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94710/1 .

blueprint add-metadata-to-secrets
Change-Id: I83115671f62e7acfd00bdfec0d4ede653284ac85

subject: Add eventlet.tpool.Proxy for DB API calls
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-27 13:32:38.000000000', 'files': ['MAINTAINERS', 'openstack/common/concurrency.py', 'tests/unit/test_concurrency.py'], 'message': "Add eventlet.tpool.Proxy for DB API calls

Since common db code started process of graduation to separate library,
it doesn't support eventlet anymore. Ability to use thread pooling
for DBAPI calls should be returned and implemented in single module.

bp add-tpool-proxy-wrapper

Change-Id: I13b59e2fe548f5b616c3286141b76b5174466b1e
"}]
commit_message:
Add eventlet.tpool.Proxy for DB API calls

Since common db code started process of graduation to separate library,
it doesn't support eventlet anymore. Ability to use thread pooling
for DBAPI calls should be returned and implemented in single module.

bp add-tpool-proxy-wrapper

subject: This is a specification for introducing Tap-as-a-Service in openstack neutron.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-28 18:34:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/juno/tap-as-a-service.rst'], 'message': 'This is a specification for introducing Tap-as-a-Service in
openstack neutron.

This specification aims to add port mirroring capability for tenant
networks in neutron. The specification covers the description of the
service along with its intended usecase. The specification also includes
the data model and REST API changes.

Addressing the review comments from Marios Andreou.

    Changes made:
    1. Removed all trailing white spaces.
    2. Added text to the performance impact section.
    3. Added text indicating further uses of the destination port
       of the service in the future under proposed changes section.
    4. Added text to indicated future usage of the service to mirror
       traffic from all the ports of a tenant virtual network in the
       description section.
    5. Other small editorial changes.

Change-Id: I6e0f12ba2210648c2f20bf9a87b1d03332f2cfe4
'}]
commit_message:
This is a specification for introducing Tap-as-a-Service in
openstack neutron.

This specification aims to add port mirroring capability for tenant
networks in neutron. The specification covers the description of the
service along with its intended usecase. The specification also includes
the data model and REST API changes.

Addressing the review comments from Marios Andreou.

    Changes made:
    1. Removed all trailing white spaces.
    2. Added text to the performance impact section.
    3. Added text indicating further uses of the destination port
       of the service in the future under proposed changes section.
    4. Added text to indicated future usage of the service to mirror
       traffic from all the ports of a tenant virtual network in the
       description section.
    5. Other small editorial changes.

Change-Id: I6e0f12ba2210648c2f20bf9a87b1d03332f2cfe4

commit_message:
Bug fix on neutron's API to return the correct target ID

In the class FloatingIpManager, the function filters the
resulting list of ports with all available floating ips.
The function now returns the target ID of a port with a
floating IP associated to it. Added a new function to get
this to pass. In the next phase is to refactor the
floating ip api to allow a finer granularity. This will
be useful later for managing floating ips.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py

Change-Id: I02286dbbb60318b0157992622ffdeeae45a71bc1
Closes-Bug: 1265872
(cherry picked from commit 86f87944900e6e713d2baaacec18f55cbe81d878)

commit_message:
Disallow regular user to update firewall's shared attribute

Shared firewalls should only be operable by  admins.
Currently only admin can provide shared attribute at firewall creation,
so update_firewall should be consistent with that as well.

Change-Id: I093743514637824207b375d724404d51f778d012
Closes-Bug: #1323322

Enable flake8 F841 checking

This check looks to see whether a local variable
is unused. Fixed all of violators of said check.

Change-Id: I6ff349ca8d650ae7d6ebeeb116a1649b0db8f071

repository, so we no longer need openstack/database-api.

commit_message:
Make config attach/detach language consistent

The external interface for configuration groups uses the terms attach
and detach for associating config groups to instances. Internally, the
code was using the terms assign/unassign. This commit changes the
internal terms to use attach/detach.

This includes changes to internal method names, comments, log messages
and exceptions.

Note - based on review feedback, the task manager
unassign_configuration method was left as is so that we wouldn't
have compatability issues. However, a new detach_configuration method
was created containing the relevant code. Now in those cases,
unassign_configuration merely calls the new detach_configuration.
Eventually the unassign method can be deprecated/removed.

Change-Id: Ic99e7a93d50f29dd8d280f7eebe57fdf695c84a3
Closes-Bug: #1312792

 - request token (oauth1 extension)

Closes-Bug: 1324076
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes duplicated DELETE queries on SQL backends

The SQL deletion queries were sent twice a delete, for these entity types:
 - Region
 - Identity provider (federation extension)
 - Protocol (federation extension)
 - Consumer (oauth1 extension)
 - Access token (oauth1 extension)
 - request token (oauth1 extension)

Change-Id: Ibfaea87a24cac00f2a187eb5c8c8917b1f0a1929
Closes-Bug: 1324076

subject: Consider free disk space before downloading images into cache
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 6623, 'name': 'Roman Prykhodchenko', 'email': 'me@romcheg.me', 'username': 'prykhodchenko'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 8125, 'name': 'Michael Davies', 'email': 'michael@the-davies.net', 'username': 'mrda'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-05-28 09:21:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/image_cache.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/common/images.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_image_cache.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py'], 'message': "Consider free disk space before downloading images into cache

This patch makes PXE driver ensure it has enough disk space
to actually download required images. If it does not, it tries
to make some space by starting cache clean up.

While it would be better to have this code in ImageCache itself,
by keeping it in PXE module we have the ability to clean up
both caches, not only current one, thus reclaiming more space.
We clean up instance image cache first, because:
1. It's probably larger
2. Instance images are not required for running instances,
   so they are more likely to be cleaned

In the follow-up patch I'll implement hints for clean_up()
call on how much space we need. Otherwise clean_up procedure
may think that nothing needs to be cleaned even though
we don't have enough space for new downloads.

This patch also adds ironic.common.images.download_size() helper
and makes master_dir attribute of ImageCache public.
One more side-effect on implementation is that values in pxe_info
dict are now tuples (as they are supposed to be), not lists.

Change-Id: I1e7294b6e7155d83e72cfd144abdca858cab0aae
Partial-Bug: #1316168
"}]
commit_message:
Consider free disk space before downloading images into cache

This patch makes PXE driver ensure it has enough disk space
to actually download required images. If it does not, it tries
to make some space by starting cache clean up.

While it would be better to have this code in ImageCache itself,
by keeping it in PXE module we have the ability to clean up
both caches, not only current one, thus reclaiming more space.
We clean up instance image cache first, because:
1. It's probably larger
2. Instance images are not required for running instances,
   so they are more likely to be cleaned

In the follow-up patch I'll implement hints for clean_up()
call on how much space we need. Otherwise clean_up procedure
may think that nothing needs to be cleaned even though
we don't have enough space for new downloads.

This patch also adds ironic.common.images.download_size() helper
and makes master_dir attribute of ImageCache public.
One more side-effect on implementation is that values in pxe_info
dict are now tuples (as they are supposed to be), not lists.

Change-Id: I1e7294b6e7155d83e72cfd144abdca858cab0aae
Partial-Bug: #1316168

use 4 spaces for indentation.

subject: Create missing domains during Bind9Backend start
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 741, 'name': 'Kiall Mac Innes', 'email': 'kiall@macinnes.ie', 'username': 'kiall'}, {'_account_id': 2064, 'name': 'Loic Dachary', 'email': 'loic@dachary.org', 'username': 'dachary'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 8130, 'name': 'Betsy Luzader', 'email': 'betsy.luzader@rackspace.com', 'username': 'bluzader'}, {'_account_id': 9041, 'name': 'Tim Freund', 'email': 'tim@freunds.net', 'username': 'timfreund'}, {'_account_id': 10240, 'name': 'Deprecated Designate CI', 'email': 'dnsaas@hp.com', 'username': 'designate-jenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-05-28 04:20:11.000000000', 'files': ['designate/backend/impl_bind9.py'], 'message': 'Create missing domains during Bind9Backend start

The Bind9Backend start function uses rndc to reload each domain.  If a
domain is missing on the Bind9 server, a ProcessExecutionError will be
raised.  This bug was recreated by stopping a bind9 process, deleting
the cached nzf files in /var/cache/bind, and restarting the process.
The Designate Central service was then restarted, and the bug triggered.

The original bug report requested that the Bind9Backend check for zones
on the server before trying to reload them, but rndc does not appear to
support that operation.

A less ideal approach is used:  the start function will now catch
ProcessExecutionError exceptions and issue a command to recreate the
zone if the caught exception indicates that the zone was not found.

Another alternative approach could use standard DNS query tools rather
than rndc to confirm zone existence.

Change-Id: Id164392f2419fc88257b9f21c1d0ef723280a8b6
Closes-Bug: #1271493
'}]
commit_message:
Create missing domains during Bind9Backend start

The Bind9Backend start function uses rndc to reload each domain.  If a
domain is missing on the Bind9 server, a ProcessExecutionError will be
raised.  This bug was recreated by stopping a bind9 process, deleting
the cached nzf files in /var/cache/bind, and restarting the process.
The Designate Central service was then restarted, and the bug triggered.

The original bug report requested that the Bind9Backend check for zones
on the server before trying to reload them, but rndc does not appear to
support that operation.

A less ideal approach is used:  the start function will now catch
ProcessExecutionError exceptions and issue a command to recreate the
zone if the caught exception indicates that the zone was not found.

Another alternative approach could use standard DNS query tools rather
than rndc to confirm zone existence.

Change-Id: Id164392f2419fc88257b9f21c1d0ef723280a8b6
Closes-Bug: #1271493

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-05-14 17:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/objects/test_fixed_ip.py', 'nova/objects/fixed_ip.py'], 'message': 'Convert address to str in fixed_ip_obj.associate

A caller of associate may pass in a netaddr.IPAddress argument which
will currently fail when it gets to sqlalchemy.  Following the
convention of other methods the netaddr.IPAddress will be cast to a

Closes-bug: 1317668

commit_message:
Convert address to str in fixed_ip_obj.associate

A caller of associate may pass in a netaddr.IPAddress argument which
will currently fail when it gets to sqlalchemy.  Following the
convention of other methods the netaddr.IPAddress will be cast to a
string.

Change-Id: I67c1876b447217b37104660ba87ed967f477b863
Closes-bug: 1317668

commit_message:
Replacing variable logger on LOG

Commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94255/1 introduces check for
translating log messages. This check uses in pattern name 'LOG', so in
heat code also should be used this name intead of 'logger'. Also same
name is used in other projects.

Change-Id: Iba24c7eb1c13e68a91d090d7bcdbcb40d6e16071
Partial-Bug: #1321283

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-27 23:27:09.000000000', 'files': ['spec/server_spec.rb', 'metadata.rb', 'templates/default/neutron.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Add missing AMQP options to neutron.conf

Using the new attributes added in common, we can allow
deployers to optionally turn on durable queues, auto-delete
for queues, and enabled QPID federation support.

Bump common dependency version, since we need the attributes
introduced in 9.4

commit_message:
Add missing AMQP options to neutron.conf

Using the new attributes added in common, we can allow
deployers to optionally turn on durable queues, auto-delete
for queues, and enabled QPID federation support.

Bump common dependency version, since we need the attributes
introduced in 9.4

Depends on change I850c01a40aab02cf4531f7983543ef89e0e60446

Change-Id: I24c70dbcaedbe8db68286f6107ddce36da80d5d8

subject: Add parameter to set veth MTU
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-28 13:59:33.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/agents/ovs.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_agents_ovs_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add parameter to set veth MTU

In many applications (including in particular NFV), it is useful
to use jumbo frames on veth pairs.  The OVS agent has a setting
enabling the user to set the MTU on veth interfaces, but it is
currently not exposed as a parameter.  This patch exposes the
veth_mtu setting and adds rspec tests accordingly.

Change-Id: I7b211be29a5630874b1c56e79ca80667f96ce425
(cherry picked from commit 3b6abf010a2c14f296044291cd381a6a7a4f92d9)
'}]
commit_message:
Add parameter to set veth MTU

In many applications (including in particular NFV), it is useful
to use jumbo frames on veth pairs.  The OVS agent has a setting
enabling the user to set the MTU on veth interfaces, but it is
currently not exposed as a parameter.  This patch exposes the
veth_mtu setting and adds rspec tests accordingly.

Change-Id: I7b211be29a5630874b1c56e79ca80667f96ce425
(cherry picked from commit 3b6abf010a2c14f296044291cd381a6a7a4f92d9)

revisions:

Change default charset to utf8 and default collation order to
utf8_unicode_ci to align with upstream defaults.

Change-Id: I0fb57f14a0d30226c840a6e920f2b3807b90080a
Closes-Bug: #1322715
(cherry picked from commit 166b00a773bb2830175bd61a451294d757453eb3)
'}]
commit_message:
Default to utf8 for MySQL

Change default charset to utf8 and default collation order to
utf8_unicode_ci to align with upstream defaults.

Change-Id: I0fb57f14a0d30226c840a6e920f2b3807b90080a
Closes-Bug: #1322715

commit_message:
Add user and password parameters to _do_login

The user and password parameters are needed for more complex login
tests (and negative ones) I plan on writing, as well as to a password
change test that will be submitted soon.
The default values for both attributes is None, so the login test
already merged won't be affected.

I also modified the if statement - it now checks whether the user is
the admin, otherwise functions the same way for all users.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/Testing/UI

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Id2987103ab0933c0d3b5eb75a25679a9a9bcca55
